*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Tsolmon D. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school and her youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

Tsolmon operates a meat trading business with the help of her husband. Her husband is responsible for purchasing meats from Dundgovi province and she sells those products in her stall as a wholesaler and retailer. She started her business in a rented stall in 2003 and has since gained much experience. 

After many years of owning this business, her daily earnings have reached 200,000 MNT. With her business revenues, she was able to build a house for her family. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress. She hopes to grow her business in the future and start to save her business profits by opening an account at the bank. Tsolmon is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase meat for resale.

loans.name: Orozbek

texts.en:
Orozbek J. is a 58-year-old farmer who lives in Kulanak village. He is married and has six children. Orozbek worked as a foreman at the local pump plant for twenty years and now receives a pension. In order to find additional means of subsistence, he decided to develop his farm that has been maintained for more than twenty years.

Orozbek started this business with initial capital of 10,000 KGS and managed to enlarge it by two cows, two sheep and ten goats. Orozbek also broadened the farm by breeding poultry; now he has seventy turkeys and thirty hens. With the revenues from this activity, he was able to buy a car for his family. Conditions are good for breeding livestock, and he plans to purchase more cattle.

Orozbek decided to apply for a loan of 52,000 KGS to buy three bull calves. With the revenue, he wants to hold his son’s wedding and build up a good dowry for his daughter.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable segment of Kyrgyzstan’s population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in the country. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services to rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To buy three bull calves

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie A., 31, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is married and has a five year old child.  To make a living, Julie raises crops, primarily from planting and harvesting rice.  He dreams of becoming a successful businessman.

Julie joined CEVI to access financial services to improve his living situation and to engage in business activities.  He requests a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase farm inputs and to pay for labor.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Hilda Efigenia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Hilda es socio fundadoras del banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y muy ordenado. Tiene 62 años de edad, mantienen una relación de unión libre por muchos años de la cual ha procreado 5 hijos, tres mujeres y dos varones todos  ellos ya son mayores de edad. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende frutas y legumbres. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00, su negocio lo tiene al lado del negocio de su esposo que es comerciante de pescado. Además de esto también cría pollos y chanchos, las legumbres y frutas las compra en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para la venta diaria. Sus sueños son tener bien construida su casa ya que es de madera y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'La Unión Hace la Fuerza' (Unity is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make which are known throughout the country.

Hilda is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because the group is very united and orderly.  Hilda is 62 years old.  She has lived with her common-law husband for many years and they have 5 children: 3 daughters and 2 sons who are all now grown up.  Her husband is a salesman.

Hilda has a stall in the market where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She works every day from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Her business is next to that of her husband who sells fish.  In addition, she also raises chickens and pigs.  She buys her fruit and vegetables in the same market from wholesale traders.

Hilda will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell every day.  Her dreams are to have a well-built home, since her home is currently made of wood, and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Elina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eugenia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza,ella vende perfumes,cremas y lápiz labiales,la socia vende en forma independiente y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza en stock.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eugenia belongs to the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Eugenia is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products.  She sells perfume, creams and lipsticks.  She sells independently and through her business she manages to get her children ahead in life.

Eugenia is requesting this loan to buy beauty products to have in stock.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to have in stock

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin B. is from the village of Margos Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 31 years old. Jasmin is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jasmin owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Jasmin is just starting this business.

In 2011, Jasmin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jasmin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman who lives in Pulupandan in the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a business buying and selling Lapu-Lapu Fish, a sari-sari (general) store, and a public utility vehicle business. Her husband Alex L., age 33, works as a fish vendor, a driver, and a barangay (village) councilor to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 1 to 10 years old.

Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 30,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing 30,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks of Lapu-Lapu Fish. She plans to continue saving up for assets in order to have a better future. The picture shows Liza together with her husband in their Lapu-Lapu Fish business. Liza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of Lapu-Lapu Fish

loans.name: Ana Gricelda

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 46 años de edad, vive con sus hijos de las de edades 26, 23, 18 y 16, residen en Lolotique departamento de San Miguel, doña Ana se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas, este negocio fue iniciado por un familiar y que después paso a manos de doña Ana, tiene ya 4 años de existir y trabaja de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar las pupusas, como maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, papel y leña, estos productos son muy necesarios en el negocio, pues son los ingredientes y materiales que hacen posible la venta.
Las aspiraciones de doña Ana es seguir incrementando el negocio, para que así su familia cuente con más ingresos y puedan seguir estudiando sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 46 years old and lives with her children (ages 26, 23, 18, and 16) in Lolotique in the Department of San Miguel. She sells pupusas and tortillas. This business was started by a relative and afterwards placed in the hands of Doña Ana. Her business has been in existence for four years and she works Monday through Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making pupusas such as corn, cheese, pork, tomatoes, paper, and firewood. These products are necessary since they include ingredients and materials that make her business possible.

Doña Ana has aspirations of continuing the growth of her business so that her family can have more income and her children can move forward in their studies.

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, pork, tomatoes, paper, and firewood

loans.name: Alfonsina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Asunción se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí  tuvimos la oportunidad de dialogar es la señora Alfonsina, es casada  y tiene su hogar muy bien formalizado,  ella tuvo dos hijos pero uno de ellos falleció. El esposo es profesor en el colegio Nacional Picoaza.

Ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa y sabanas y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, dice que empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del Banco, trabaja cuatro días a la semana y los fines de semana cobra ya que deja a crédito. Para poder surtir su negocio tiene que viajar hasta las ciudades de Guayaquil y Quito cada 15 días. En la actualidad lo que más vende es ropa de temporada como trajes de baño, bermudas y gorras. También está vendiendo bisuterías y gafas sobretodo de damas.

Este nuevo crédito lo invertirá en sabanas, gafas, bisutería y ropa de temporada. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir ya que gracias ellos pudo empezar su negocio. El sueño de nuestra socia es llegar a tener su almacén con todos los servicios para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The village bank Maria Asuncion meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a commercial zone, and for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, as well as for the happiness of its people.  

Here we had the opportunity to speak with Alfonsina.  She is married and has her home well put together.  She had two children, but one of them passed away.  Her husband is a teacher at the Picoaza National school.  

She sells clothes and sheets door-to-door.  She says that she began her business with the first loan that she received from the bank.  She works 4 days a week and on the weekends she collects money for the orders that she left on credit.  In order to furnish goods for her business she has to travel to the cities of Guayaquil and Quito every 15 days.  Currently she mostly sells seasonal clothing, like bathing suits, shorts and caps.  She also sells miscellaneous goods and sunglasses, mostly for women. 

This new loan will be invested in sheets, sunglasses, miscellaneous goods and seasonal clothing.  She is a founding member of the village bank and is very grateful to the Espoir Foundation since she was able to start her business thanks to them.  Her dream is to have a shop with all of the services for her customers.

loans.use: To buy sheets, glasses, miscellaneous goods and seasonal clothing

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es:
Juan tiene 67 años, es casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años. Viven en la parte urbana del distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace más de 20 años, se dedica a la venta de bolsas. Vende sus productos diariamente en un puesto en el mercado local de Chepén. Juan es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Juan es muy trabajador y responsable. Tiene buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Su mayor anhelo sigue siendo trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 67 years old, married, and has a 15 year-old son.  They live in the urban part of Chepén district, in La Libertad region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than 20 years, Juan has been selling bags.  He sells his products daily from a stall in Chepén local market.  Juan is very well known in his area and has an established customer base.  He would like to expand his business by purchasing more merchandise to sell.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Juan is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He has good work references and personal references from his community.  His greatest wish is to continue working to get his family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more bags

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en:
Erisa is a 50-year-old married man with eight children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in a retail shop for five years. He started with a capital of 600,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. 

His hardships include debtors, price fluctuation and high transport costs.

His vision is to own a large retail shop and to educate children.

Erisa would like to buy rice, salt, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, cooking oil and sugar for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El sr. Francisco oriundo de la localidad de San José, su actividad es la explotación de áridos en el rio Pirai (explota y lava arena, piedra para vender a los constructores), se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo, también cuenta con una draga la cual es instrumento en su trabajo  casado con la señora Andrea quien le ayuda en esta actividad, con el dinero del crédito realizara mantenimiento de motor (draga), el Sr. Francisco es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, deseando mejorar su calidad de vida, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Francisco is native of San Jose.  His business is working with sand and rocks in the Pirai river (he obtains and washes the sand and rock to later sell to contractors)  He has been in this business for quite a while.  He also has a dredger which is the main equipment for his type of work.  He is married to Andrea who helps him in his business.  With the money from the loan he will repair his dredger.  Mr. Francisco is a very hard working man and is always thinking of the well being of his family and wishing to improve their quality of life.  He is very grateful to this institution for all the help that they provide.

loans.use: to maintain the dredger motor.

loans.name: Tweweyo Women's Group

texts.en: 49-year-old N. Sarah has been operating her general merchandise retail shop for the past 15 years in Buvuma Island, Lugazi. The happily married mother of seven says she began this business with savings from her agro sales business. Through the course of those years in business, she says, it's been diligence, determination and prayers that have kept her business afloat. Sarah also ekes out additional profits from a fish selling business. Weekly, she says, her profits are approximately 100,000 shillings. With this loan, she says, she is going to purchase more retail general merchandise commodities to resell. In the group photo, one lady client was not around when the photo was taken, so I marked her as unpictured. The male client marked as unpictured actually appears in the photo but he did not look directly into the camera.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Orfa Raquel

texts.es:
Orfa Raquel  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 17 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios (incompleto).
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace un ciclo, su primer préstamo solicitado fue  por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales domésticos como ovino, vacuno y porcino.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará una vaquita, en este negocio le ayuda su esposo quien  trabaja en construcción civil en la ciudad de Arequipa y la ayuda cuando llega a Puno.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener una mejor vivienda para el futuro.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la reunión donde comparte con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Orfa Raquel is a member of the Sisters of Choquetanca II Communal Bank, located in the Llave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 17 years old, lives with her partner and has no children; she has a high school education but didn’t graduate.

Orfa Raquel has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year, her first loan was S/. 500.00 nuevos soles and was used in her business, buying and selling domestic animals like sheep, cattle and pigs.

With this new loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles she will buy a cow, her business helps her husband who works in construction in the city of Arequipa, he helps her when he arrives to Puno.

Orfa Raquel’s dream is to improve her house and have a better home for the future.

What she enjoys about her Communal Bank is the meetings that she attends with the other members.

loans.use: buy a cow.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 48-year-old farmer from the village of Pereta, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is married and lives in the village with her husband Eldar, a 17-year-old son, and a 10-year-old daughter. Their children go to the village school. 

Nino and Eldar earn approximately 900 Laris per month from agricultural activities. They have three milk cows; they produce cheese, which is sold at the local market. Also they have a vineyard with 1500 wine trees. The grapes are used for producing wine, which is sold in the village. 

With the requested loan Nino plans to expand the dairy farm by purchasing an additional milk cow. Nino will be able to produce more cheese and get more income from cheese sales. Nino regularly saves money for investing in the further development of the farm. She hopes that in the future the scale and the profitability of their farm will increase.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Esmaelita has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages, She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Esmaelita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Esmaelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Walter; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de mototaxi,el hace servicio de taxi pero en una moto en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Urubamba, el socio también tiene un negocio de venta de papa y su esposa es la que realiza el negocio y por medio de este negocio y trabajo sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa y mejorar el trabajo de mototaxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar papas y para el mantenimiento de su moto.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Walter, 38, is a member of the “El Diamante de Urubamba” (Urubamba’s Diamond) communal bank located in Urubamba District, Cusco Province and Department.

He has a spouse and two children.  He alternates his daily activities working with a mototaxi.  He provides taxi services but with a motorcycle throughout Urubamba’s streets.  He also has a business selling potatoes that his wife runs.  Through this business and his work they are able to support their children.  He wants to expand the potato sales and improve the work of the mototaxi.  He is asking for a loan to buy potatoes and to service his motorcycle.

He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, a single mother of two school-aged children, is 28 years old and living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. The operator of a retail sari-sari store business for three years now, she earns about PHP 5,000.00 a month.

A member of GDMPC for almost year, Elvie has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy additional liquor and soft drink stocks to sell in the local community. She hopes to expand her business and gain more profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional liquor and soft drink stocks to sell.

loans.name: Phalley

texts.en: Phalley is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $7 per day. She has two children who are eight and four years old. Both of them are studying. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy wood to repair her house. She has skills as a tailor and she wants to open a tailoring shop when she has enough money to start. For her children, she will help them to study until they finish the university.

loans.use: To buy wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana, es habitante de Ticuantepe. Junto a su esposo e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , tiene  una hija a su cargo los demás ya son casados e independientes , doña Juana tiene varios años que se dedica al comercio , actualmente vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Managua , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las alzas de los productos y perdidas en algunas ocasiones del mismo , agradece Afodenic que atrávez de los fondos Kiva poco a poco va comprando materiales de construcción para terminar su humilde vivienda .
texts.en: Mrs. Juana lives in Ticuantepe with her husband and one daughter who is still in her care.  She has other children who are married and independent. Her plans are to improve their living conditions in the future.  Juana has been a vendor for several years and currently sells fruit and vegetables at the market in Managua.  Her greatest difficulty is overcoming the rise and fall of product prices which can cause losses.  She is grateful to Afodenic for the Kiva fund that  helps her, little by little, buy the construction materials she needs to finish her humble dwelling.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is a 44 year-old married man who lives in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia  He is the father of one son who is dependent on him. He is a very hard-working and good man. He is appreciated by all his friends and neighbors because he always helps others and does well.

Ya has been farming for more than 15 years. Due to the rainy season and lack of money, Ya would like to request some funding through HKL's partnership with Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials. He hopes that this funding will develop his family better and better, and send his child to study at high level as others.  Ya is pictured with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials.

loans.name: Ulfatkan's Group

texts.en:
Ulfatkan is the leader of this group. She is 54, and married to farmer who is also engaged in cattle breeding. Together with her husband, she has raised a son and two daughters. The son helps with housework, and the daughters are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn additional money for the family, Ulfatkan sells salads. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase products for preparing salads. In the future, she wants to see her son get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase products for preparing salads.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She is 40 years old and has 3 children aged 22, 20 and 18.

Magdalena has been in the hog-raising business for 15 years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month from her business. Magdalena also owns a parcel of land where she grows rice crops. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed. Magdalena hopes to succeed in her ventures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more stock for her business.

Editha has been in this business for 5 years. She also earns income from food vending and selling plastic ware.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama fries fresh fish at Elmina. She has an additional trade which is the selling of different types of soaps. She is divorced and has 6 children.  She is assisted by her ex-spouse to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 34-year-old single mother of two children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build rental houses so she can earn income out of them. Agnes has been selling produce for the last three years. She started with a capital of 200,000, but now the business is worth 1,000,000. In spite of this, Agnes has been challenged by the high cost of rent and the rainy season, which makes transportation of the produce from the village difficult. She needs the loan to buy maize grains for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize grains for selling

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María, necesita invertir en el negocio, por esta razón solicita otra vez un préstamo, e invertirlo en frutas, verduras, carnes, huevos, leche, pan, para ofrecer en el negocio, ella está motivada, ya que la inversión anterior le dio buenos resultados, sus ganancias aumentaron y pudo pagar el préstamo sin atrasos; la condición familiar mejoro, pues al tener disponible más dinero, también pudo ofrecer una vida mejor en estos meses a la familia.
texts.en: María needs to invest in her business.  For this reason, she is requesting another loan.  She will invest her loan in buying fruit, vegetables, meat, eggs, milk and bread to offer in her business.  She is motivated because her previous investment gave her good results.  Her profits increased and she was able to repay her loan punctually.  Her family's conditions improved because she had more money available and so was able to offer a better life to her family over these months.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, eggs, milk and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Colombian style cheese bread.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: La Sra. María vive en la zona del plan 3000 en casa propia, Tiene 45 años, tiene hijos  mayores. La Sra. María se dedica a la venta de comida los platos de chuleta, bife, sopa de maní y otros. Su esposo es pintor de vivienda, es muy solicitado por su clientes ya que realiza trabajos muy buenos, la Sra.  María vende comida en su  propio domicilio  tiene pensionados y también vende a algunas entidades financieras, también vende masitas elaboradas con harina de maíz con jugos de frutas, la Sra. María vende variedad de productos de comida para distintas horas del día. La Sra. María  es una persona muy  responsables tiene el propósito de superación, el crédito tiene la finalidad de compra de insumos para ala elaboración de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, papa y aceite, se siente agradecida con la institución ya que le brinda un apoyo para crecer en su negocio ya que esta es su única fuente de ingreso.
texts.en: Sra. María lives in the area called Plan 3000 in her own house. She is 45 years old and has children who are already adults. Sra. Maria sells food such as beef, steak, peanut soup and others. Her husband paints houses and is in high demand by his customers as he does a very good job. Sra. Maria sells the food from her own house, to pensioners and also to some financial institutions. She also sells cornmeal and fruit juice biscuits. Sra. Maria sells a variety of food to suit the time of day. Sra. Maria is a very responsible person and intends to repay her loan quickly. With the loan she will buy ingredients to make her dishes such as rice, sugar, potatoes and oil. She is grateful to the institution for the support given her to grow her business as it is her sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil, noodles, potatoes to make her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Despite his young age, Alvin patiently works on his family farm to attain a better quality of life for his family. He is 18 years old and works on his farm to feed his family. He doesn’t want to see his parents working so hard just to provide their daily needs, so he decided to operate a farming business to attain this desire. 

He earned approximately PHP 15,000 last crop, and he used his income for allowances for his two school-age siblings, household expenses, and food. Because of these costly needs, he was not be able to save for his farming business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amount PHP18,000 to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to continue his farming business. 

He hopes to further grow his business for the betterment of their life.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide use to continue his farming business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliza is 42-years old and has four children who are in school.

Flordeliza has a food vending (rice cakes) business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 7 years. Flordeliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Weddy

texts.en: Weddy is a 33-year-old single woman. She has 4 children, ages ranging from 5 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a populated area. She also runs a retail shop to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.  She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more livestock for milking. Weddy's hope and dream is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Najaf

texts.en:
Najaf is refugee from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. His refugee life, full of challenges and uncertainties, began in the city of Sumgayit, where he is involved in cattle trade since 1998. The organization that really gave a push to his business was Norwegian Microcredit (Normicro). Loans of 700 and 900 USD in 2003-2004 were followed by the loan of 1000 USD in 2005. Within the period of his partnership with Normicro, no late payments were available.

Today, this refugee-turned-entrepreneur is a rather successful businessman. He applies for the loan of 1,800 USD to buy 3 cows and 5 sheep. Among his plans is inception of milk and cheese production. He believes in himself and his repayment capacity.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows and 5 sheep

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a divorced mother of one daughter. She first became an entrepreneur 12 years ago when she started working in one of the local markets selling women’s clothing. However, soon her sales began to go down so she decided to change locations and start a new venture in the busiest city market. She received a loan from “Nadiya Ukraine”, bought a kiosk and went to work. Today Irina runs a prosperous small business selling seasonal clothing for women. Irina has proven to be a successful entrepreneur. She is very active, loves challenges and is continuously seeking new opportunities. Irina is very passionate about her work – she lives every minute of her life to its fullest. At the same time, she is very responsible and has repaid every loan from “Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. Irina would like to get a loan for $500 to purchase a new vending facility in the central city market. She is planning to do some necessary reconstruction work and buy an assortment of new inventory in bulk. Irina thinks that a variety of good quality knitted wear, sweaters, jerseys, and T-shirts will sell well and will attract many potential customers to her business. We believe that Irina’s entrepreneurial ambition, hard work and optimistic attitude in combination with financial assistance will promote the further growth of Irina’s business and will ensure better living standards for her family.

Ірина – розлучена, в неї є дочка. Вона стала підприємцем 12 років тому, коли почала торгувати жіночим одягом на одному з місцевих ринків. Однак, обсяги її продажів дуже швидко знизилися, тому вона вирішила змінити розташування свого кіоску, почала торгувати на найбільшому міському ринку. Отримавши позику від „Надії України” Ірина придбала кіоск та взялася до роботи. Зараз вона – досить успішний підприємець, торгує сезонним жіночим одягом. Ірина довела, що вона – успішний підприємець. Вона – дуже активна, полюбляє виклик, постійно шукає нових можливостей. Ірина дуже віддано ставиться до своєї роботи – вона намагається жити на повну силу. У той же час вона дуже відповідальна, сплатила усі позики від „Надії України” без жодних прострочень. Ірина хотіла б отримати позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове приміщення на центральному ринку. Вона планує зробити необхідний ремонт, закупити оптом товар. Ірина вважає, що широкий вибір якісних трикотажних товарів, светрів, кофт та футболок обов’язково користуватимуться попитом серед потенційних покупців. Ми віримо, що підприємницькі прагнення Ірини, її наполеглива праця та оптимізм у поєднанні з фінансовою допомогою сприятимуть подальшому зростанню бізнесу Ірини та забезпечать кращий рівень життя для її родини.

loans.use: To purchase a vending facility in the market

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a visionary young entrepreneur from Izum, Ukraine, who is on the pathway to success. She operates a bustling little store where she sells an attractive array of fruits and vegetables. Olga started her business as an open-air market vendor. With help from Nadiya Ukraine she was able to open a small storefront facility and gained a great competitive advantage by having a clean, indoor space to offer her selections. At her previous location she would typically earn around $20-$60 per day. With her new store, her income has increased to between $40 and as high as $180 per day.

Olga understands the value of customer service – a quality which sets her apart from many other business owners. She is attentive and polite to her customers and tries to give them each her individual attention.

Olga has requested a loan for two purposes. She’d like to use some as working capital to buy necessary inventory, but her primary goal is to use some funds to help open a new vending kiosk. She has a good location in mind across from a technical plant in Izum. With her history thus far as an entrepreneur, it will be exciting to watch how her business will grow and prosper in the future.

loans.use: Increase inventory and open new location

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mr. Sang C. is 27 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with his wife (pictured here) and their 2 young children.  He and his wife both work at a hotel.  Together, they earn about $9/day.  This loan will be used for Mr. Sang to repair the leaks in his home in time for the coming rainy season.

loans.use: To repair his family's home

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
To live peacefully and modestly is the hope of every family. Although living in a small hut with bamboo weaved walls, Ketut K. family seems to be peaceful and happy. Her husband work as a tenant farmer. He is very responsible towards his family. His hard work is not wasted by Kakek Budi, his children was able to finish high school. After marrying Ketut K. never stopped raising pigs though in very small numbers, only 1 or 2 each time, and even that done the traditional way by putting the pig on leash under a tree. Morning and evenings the pigs were fed with food obtained from the fields: leaves or talas roots that was cooked and sometimes mixed with rice shells during rice-harvest. After 3 months the pigs could be sold for Rp350,000 (about $38)/each. With the loan to be obtained, Ketut K. will add another pig, and the rest to buy better foods like rice shells, concentrate or polar so that the pigs could grow faster. Also with the lengthy dry season reserve feed from the fields are getting difficult to obtain. With one additional pig and better feed, Ketut K. is convinced that she could get Rp300,000 (about $35)/month nett, and this would add to daily family living expense, which average Rp20,000 (about $2.10) /day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup rukun dan bersahaja merupakan idaman bagi setiap keluarga, walau dengan gubuk kecil yang berdindingkan gedek bambu keluarga Ketut K. kelihatan rukun dan sangat bahagia. Suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani sangat bertanggung jawab terhadap keluarganya. kerja kerasnya ini juga tak di sia-siakan oleh Kadek budi antara anak nya untuk menyelesaikan pendidikannya sampai tingkat SMA. Sejak menikah Ketut K. Tak pernah putus memelihara babi walau hanya dalam jumlah yang kecil yaitu 1 sampai 2 ekor saja, dan itupun dengan cara yg masih tradisional Babinya di ikat di bawah pohon, pagi dan sore ternaknya diberi makanan yg di buat/diperoleh dari sawah berupa daun daunan dan pohon ubi talas yg di masak. dan kadang-kadang di campur dedak kalau lagi musim panen padi. Setelah tiga bulan babinya laku di jual Rp 350.000/ekor. Dengan pinjaman yang di dapat Ketut K. akan menambah lagi satu ekor ternaknya dan sisanya di pergunakan untuk membeli pakan yg lebih baik Seperti Dedak, Konsentrat dan juga Polar supaya ternaknya lebih cepat besar, di samping juga persediaan pakan di sawah mulai susah didapat karena musim kemarau yg panjang. Dengan tambahan 1 ekor ternak dan pakan yang juga berubah sekarang Ketut K. yakin bisa mendapatkan hasil bersih panen ternaknya Rp 300.000/ bulan, dan hasil ini cukup membantu menambah biaya kebutuhan hidup keluarganya yang rata -rata Rp 20.000 Perhari.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit Babi dan Pakan ternak

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She and her family were relocated to the Garachukhur settlement in the eastern suburbs of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict.  She is married and has two childen.  She and her husband have built a small shop and she started their business of trading food stuff in 1997.  She has had a previous loan from Normicro Baku branch in the amount of $450.  Now her stock of goods is down and she has little of her own funds.  She has applied to Normicro again to borrow $700 to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of goods

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en: Fuzuli G. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 36 years old, married and has two children.  Fuzuli has been engaged in animal-breeding for a long time.  He has some cows and some sheep.  Fuzuli has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch in the past and repaid these loans timely.  Now he needs a loan in the amount of $900 for buying ten sheep.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Oliva M. is 38 years old. She is married with five children, ages 4,9,13,15, and 17. In 1995, Oliva established a hardware and grocery store. She now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stock in bulk

loans.name: Nangwe Madibira (I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Sarah Acheno. She currently sells dry foods and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Sarah is 35 years old and is married. She has seven children, ranging in age from 8 to 18, who attend school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 70000 (US$40.00) in profit. With the extra profit she will make with the help of a loan, she hopes to pay the school fees for her children. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 600000 (US$353.00), to invest in her business by increasing the stock in the shop. The loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Prisca W., Mariam M., Anda A. and Tausi G.. Prisca W. sells millet flour. Mariam M. has a cosmetics shop. Anda A. operates a hardware shop and Tausi G. sells maize flour. All four women request the loan to expand their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Kyowamwino D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine A.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Christine is 22 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 2 and 4, and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a grading machine.

Christine is joined in her small group by Hellen N., Florence A., Mary A., and Scolastica N.. Hellen N. has a business selling fish and wants to expand it. Florence A. is currently operating a business selling maize and wants a loan to increase her inventory. Mary A. operates a business selling cabbage and wants to boost her sales. Scolastica N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more baskets of tomatoes.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items like salt, flour and soap

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Bui Thi H. is 34 years old and has 2 children. Her main business is raising fish, ducks and pigs. Every day she collects duck eggs to sell at the village market. She also teaches morning kindergarten at a nearby school. All of these jobs keep her busy, but she is satisfied with her life. This month she hopes to borrow $825 to expand her livestock raising business.

loans.use: Invest in ducks

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac L. M. is forty years old. He is married and the father of five children who are currently in school. Isaac is a manufacturer of liquid soap and has supplied his products to restaurants and canteen operators over the last year. His production is on a very small scale due to capital inadequacy. He wants to use the loan to buy more stock of raw materials like base, salt, colour, and bottles to expand his production and increase his income. His dream is to see his business grow bigger to allow him to better support his family’s basic needs and children’s educational needs. He belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of raw materials like base, salt, colour, and bottles.

loans.name: Twaha Ally's Tupendana C Group

texts.en:
Twaha A., age 38, is married with one 2-year-old daughter. He sells mosquito nets, a business he started eight years ago. He works from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $31.

Twaha has taken out four previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his capital. He hopes for a new loan to buy bricks to build a small house. Twaha will share this loan with his loan group, named Tependane C, whose 18 members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

In the picture Twaha is second from right, standing at the back.

loans.use: To buy bricks to build a house

loans.name: El Eden Iii Group

texts.en:
Celenia S. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in a small town in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Two years ago she opened a small colmado, or store that sells staple foods and accessories. But she lacks enough capital to buy inventory for her store. The money from this loan will go towards buying oil, rice, sugar and flour to sell to her customers. Celenia said that she hopes to continue to grow her business so that she will be able to support her five children (ages 21, 20, 19, 17, and 16) and continue providing them with the education they need to obtain good jobs in the future.

Celenia leads a five-person group, El Eden III. Each of these Dominican entrepreneurs unites in solidarity, so that they can secure access to funding that they would never otherwise be able to receive on their own. One of the other women in the group has a small salon, one prepares and sells food in the street and the others sell clothing.

On behalf of Celenia, the El Eden group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support for this group!

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, rice and sugar

loans.name: Harriet Kyosimire` S Group

texts.en:
Harriet K. is the leader of a group of four women. She is 35, married and has three children that are 15, 13, and 11 years of age.  All of her children are currently in school.  

Harriet has been selling old clothes in Owino Market, one of the largest markets in Kampala, for the past ten years.  She buys the shoes from other sellers in the market and then resells them.  Harriet works six days a week selling her clothes to men and women.  The biggest hurdle she faces in running her business is the escalating price of clothes.

Harriet plans on using this current loan to increase her stock of clothes.  She has been working with MCDT for the past five years.  Harriet originally decided to work with MCDT because they help women and she didn't have her own money to make her business successful.

Since Harriet began working with MCDT, she has been able to pay school fees for all her children and purchase enough food to feed her family.  Harriet hopes to one day buy a plot of land and build a house rather than rent a house as she does currently.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Memunatu's Group

texts.en: Memunatu T. is the leader of Unity Group, a microfinance collective with four other members: Ramatu M., Isatu M., Mamusu K. and Sally B.. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni City and are requesting a loan of $1175, which will enable them increase the sizes of their businesses.  Previous loans have been taken out and repaid by the members of Unity Group.  Memunatu herself, however, was born in Makeni City 30 years ago and is married to a truck driver.  They have three children, all of whom go to school.  Memunatu has been working in the firewood business for over five years, and sells wood to her neighbours for a marginal profit, which she uses to feed and clothe her family.  Now she is hoping, along with her colleagues, to expand her business with a new loan.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses

loans.name: Francis

texts.es: Francis, de 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando para salir adelante, ella y su esposo Eduardo tienen el deseo de progresar en su negocio y mediante el mismo, sacar adelante a sus hijos. Francis se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, esta tienda es el sustento económico de ella y su  familia. Ahora tiene el propósito de ampliar su negocio, comprar productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Francis logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Francis is 29 years old and has two children. They are her motivation to live and to continue fighting to get ahead. Francis and her husband Eduardo would like to grow their business and use it as a means of getting their children ahead. Francis sells groceries and basic goods, and her store supports her and her family. Now she would like to expand her business, buy food products, and above all, improve the structure of her home. She therefore needs the capital to reach her goal. Thanks to your help, Mrs. Francis will achieve her goal in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of basic goods that she sells in her store.

loans.name: Loida Grimaneza

texts.es:
La señora Loida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en el Jr. Padre Biedma Nº 168, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor D. Educación Primaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300, deciD. invertir en la venta D. zapatos. Tiene 2 años en Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. Bocaditos y productos D. belleza (ORIFLAME). Tiene el apoyo D. su hijo. En las mañanas prepara sus bocaditos para venderlos por las tardes a sus clientes.   

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una selladora, 8 kilos D. harina, 6 kilos D. azúcar, 6 paquetes D. bolsas, aceite y productos D. belleza. 

Loida está agradecida con el Banco Comunal porque su negocio ha mejorado y desea seguir triunfando en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Loida belongs to the communal bank called "United Neighbors", located in the district of Calleria in the area of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayalli. She's 54 years old. She's the mother of 4 adult children. She's married and her husband is an elementary school teacher. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling shoes. She has been a client of Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She currently sells snacks and cosmetic products called Oriflame. She has the support of her children. In the mornings, she prepares the snacks so that she can sell them to her clients later in the afternoon. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase a vacuum sealer, 8 kilos of flour, 6 kilos of sugar, 6 packets of plastic bags, cooking oil and beauty products. Loida is very thankful to the Communal Bank because her business has improved and she hopes to keep being successful in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum sealer, flour, sugar, plastic bags, cooking oil and beauty products

loans.name: Kimhoin

texts.en: Mrs. Kimhoin S. is 29 years old and now lives in Khnol Dambang village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Her business is currently going well, and she would like to expand it so she is seeking a loan to buy more piglets and pig food, thereby increasing her income and improving her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Sat Soeurn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Kimhoin S. has two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor G. tiene un pequeño negocio de video juegos, el cual es atendido por su esposa la Sra. Karla Lorena. Don Luis se encarga de la administración debido a que su empleo de planta no le permite estar todos los dias al frente, solo cuando no tiene programado viajar él, le ayuda.
Los viajes que realiza son del empleo que tiene en una línea transportista. 
Nos comentan que desean agrandar el negocio, tener variedad de comida rápida (un snack), para los niños y jóvenes que acuden y así puedan disfrutar del juego acompañado de algún bocadillo.
Ellos tienen poco con este proyecto pero tienen muchas esperanzas puestas en el mismo, desean que ustedes los apoyen para lograr sus metas; se los agradecerán siempre. En el momento de la visita el Sr. G. no se encontraba, asi que solo sale la Sra. Karla.
texts.en:
Mr. Gutierrez has a small videogame and snack shop that his wife Karla runs. Mr Gutierrez is in charge of the administration of the business since his job with a transportation company requires a lot of traveling. When he is not traveling he helps Karla with the business. They would like to expand their shop, to have a variety of fast food for the kids and young people that come to play videogames—this way they can enjoy the games with a snack. Mr. Gutierrez and Karla do not have much, but they have a lot of hopes for this project. They hope you can help them achieve their goals and they will be forever grateful. Due to his travels Mr. Gutierrez was not available for a picture, but pictured above is Karla.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with one child. She rents a space at Furshet grocery store and sells dishes and cosmetics. Olga started this business 6 years ago. She likes working with people and enjoys selling high quality products. She is a hard working person and is determined to develop this business further.
Olga is requesting a loan of $600 to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive more income and to be able to fix her apartment and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
El Sr. Joaquin N. B., cliente que se dedica a la construcción, realiza trabajos de albañilería, plomería y carpintería, tiene actualmente un contrato en la población de Coroico, él sale cada semana a ver a su familia, tambien  trabaja en arreglo de viviendas por la zona donde vive.
El Sr. Joaquin tiene casa propia y una familia compuesta por la esposa y dos hijos en edad escolar. La esposa trabaja como empleada del hogar en una casa de Los Pinos, y los fines de semana trabaja en una chicharroneria cerca de su domicilio.
Hace dos años que trabaja con Emprender, se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia debido a que por su trabajo solicito plazos largos, pero siempre demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Joaquin N. B., a client who works in construction, does work in masonry, plumbing, and carpentry. He currently has a contract in the town of Coroico. He leaves every week to see his family. He also does home repairs in the region where he lives. Joaquin has his own home and a family comprised of his wife and two school-aged children. His wife works as an employee in a home in Los Pinos and on the weekends works at a "chicharroneria" [a type of restaurant] near her home. Joaquin has been working with Emprender for 2 years. He finds himself in his fourth sequence due to the fact that for his work he asks for long installments. However, he always demonstrates punctuality and responsibility in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha K. is a villager in Damnak Roveang Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Seak Sok, is a motorbike taxi driver who faces a small problem because his motorbike is too old and he usually spends much money on petroleum to support his bike. Thus, Mrs. Sokha K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. She is 46 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Dame K. Essi agée de 34 ans, est une femme née dans le village de Tchékpo Dédékpo, localité située à 58 km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité la restauration dans le quartier d’Avedzi.
Ce premier crédit quelle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 4 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile végétale. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Essi K. is 34 years old. She was born in the village of Tchékpo Dédékpo, which is 58 kilometres from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children. She has a restaurant in the neighbourhood of Avedzi. This is her first loan which she is asking for in order to buy four bags of rice, three drums of vegetable oil. With the revenues from her business she will be able to help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing a dryer and hair extensions for re-sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Since 2006, Ama A. has worked as a trader selling tomatoes, red oil and garden eggs at Sekondi Market near Shama Junction. She is a widow with four children and has received no formal education. Ama assumes full financial responsibility for the household and is the main provider for her family. Her loan will be used to purchase additional goods, especially onions, which she will then resell. Ama hopes to use her newly gained profits to add to the capital of her business and ensure her continued success.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods, especially onions

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.en:
D. Viên Thị is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has a school-aged child. D. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. D. has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, D. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.

D. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. D. plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Jesus De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz.
Jesús es separada tiene 38 años, tres hijos de  11, 5 y 3 años. que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Jesús estudio secretariado, pero nunca lo ejerció por que se dedico al negocio, trabajo siete años en la venta de cosméticos, repartía a tiendas y puestos  en los campos fériales, cambio de negocio porque le debían mucho, siempre quiso vender licores por que en su zona no había. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió hacer puntual en los pagos y hacer esforzada en su negocio.
Necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de vinos, cervezas, gaseosas, cigarros, chicles.
El sueño de Jesús es poner un video pub
texts.en:
Jesus is a member of the Maria de la Paz communal bank. Jesus is separated. She is 38 years old and has three children, ages 11, 5 and 3, who are all in public school. Jesus studied secretarial work, but did not move forward with it because she dedicated herself to business. She worked in cosmetics sales for 7 years, distributing them to stores and stalls at fairgrounds. She changed businesses because she was owed a good deal of money. She has always wanted to sell alcohol because there is no liquor store in her neighborhood. Since joining Finca, she has learned to make her payments on time and put more effort into her business. She needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase wine, beer, sodas, cigars and gum. Jesus' dream is to open a bar.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase beverages: wines, sodas

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is the mother of four who believes that poverty is not a hindrance to success. Thus, she is doing her best in sending all her children to school, for them to have good job opportunities someday.

Because of a lack of financial resources, Rosalina is borrowing PHP 7,000 to further sustain her hog-raising business in their village at Bimonton Mallig, Isabela. She has a strong determination to become successful in all her plans in life and she did it by having three of her children graduated from their college courses so that she now only supports the education of her youngest child.

Rosalina’s husband, Warlito, is grateful for having her as his wife and they are helping each other in reaching out for their family success.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Las Ungidas 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
20-year-old Nemesi partially demonstrates her maturity by the fact that she is one of the coordinators for the Bank of Hope Las Ungidas. She also looks after her three younger brothers who live with her. She plans to use her increased profits to help pay for their school which will resume in August. Using her house as a base, Nemesi plans to use this loan to expand her business of selling wallets, purses, shoes, and skirts. The capital, Santo Domingo, is about an hour away from her home in Los Alcarrizos and Nemesi plans to make bimonthly trips there to purchase her merchandise for the best price. 

Not only is Nemesi excited about expanding her business efforts, but she is also excited about the responsibilities associated with being a group coordinator. Esperanza International uses the Grameen model of group lending. This means that if one member in the group defaults, the other members are responsible for this portion too. Thus, it is important the group maintains a sense of solidarity and actively works through problems together. Nemesi is eager to help facilitate these conversations and unity. She described “solidarity” as a little word that has great meaning; that it means a group commitment to helping one another mutually attain goals and overcome obstacles. 


On behalf of Carmen Nemesi, the Bank of Hope “Las Ungidas,” and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need it most.

loans.use: To expand her busines

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a married, 40-year-old father of three children. He owns and operates a printing house in Ramallah city in Palestine, where he provides all types of printing services with the help of several employees.

Murad is seeking a loan in the amount of $3,000 USD so that he may invest in additional paper, ink, and printing machine parts to further expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To improve and expand his printing business by purchasing paper, ink, and machine parts

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through National Vocational Training Institute (NVTI). Her husband is a trader

Patricia has a small shop at Elmina where she sells groceries, which she has done since 2007. She uses her income to pay school fees and other bills.

Patricia will use the loan to purchase more grocery items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patricia plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nothing For Nothing Group

texts.en:
Nothing for Nothing is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Rebecca L., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Rebecca is married with 4 children, age 6-12, who are all in school.  She also takes care of 2 orphans.   She is 34 years old, is illiterate, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Rebecca’s business is selling rice retail, which she buys wholesale, in Bokeza town. She has been running her business for 3 years.   She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a more permanent shop, investing in the future of her kids, especially school which she was unable to attend.

loans.use: Increase rice inventory

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn B.'s main source of income comes from providing motorcab services to local community members. She is 29 years old, married and has four children. They are from the city of Tinago Ozamiz City. Jonalyn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jonalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jonalyn is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This will be Jonalyn's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Sarou

texts.en: Mrs. Sarou K. lives in Ta Smoin village in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this business is going well she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for sell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Chrun Sao, helps her in the business. Mrs. Sarou K. has a child who is attending a primary school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe Benkadi (une veuve, deux célibataires et 5 mariées),  ont en moyenne 32 ans, 2 enfants et  vivent dans des ménages monogames  dans le quartier Bozo à Diamarabougou  de Markala relevant de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe se sont connus par des relations de parenté de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes bozos qui existe  depuis  plus de 10 ans.
Après quatre 4 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés sans aucune difficulté, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à son 5ème prêt de groupe.
 Elles comptent utiliser leur prêt pour acheter, 462kg de poissons, 15 sachets de glace et 4 cartons de poissons fumés. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons fumés à Macina (Mignon et Diado), en poissons frais sur place à Markala au bord du fleuve Niger au niveau du pont, dans les zones de pêche de Markala et à Niono (Dora), en glace à Seribala et Dougabougou. Les poissons sont vendus à Bamako, Ségou (marché du château) et sur place à Markala sous toutes les formes, frais, frits, fumés et séchés, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elles disposent de  fours et séchoirs traditionnels spécialement conçus dans un coin de leurs cours pour la fumage et le séchage des poissons.  
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 60 500 FCFA par mois qui servira d’épargne en vue de l’achat de congélateur, à la contribution d’achat de matériels de pêche pour leurs maris, aux frais scolaires des enfants et aux petites dépenses familiales notamment (savon, habillements).
Elles ont pour ambition de posséder  chacune un congélateur afin de diminuer les charges.
texts.en:
The eight members of Benkadi Group (one widowed, two single and five married women), on average, are 32 years old and have two children. They live in monogamous families in the neighborhood of Bozo in the city of Diamarabougou de Markala, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are neighbors or family members to each other and are members of the same traditional association of women from Bozo, which has existed for over ten years. The women of Benkadi Group have repaid without difficulty their previous four group loans on schedule and are now applying for their fifth group loan.

They will use their loan to buy 462 kg of fish, 15 bags of ice and 4 boxes of smoked fish. They get their supply of smoked fish in Macina (Mignon and Diado), of fresh fish on location in Markala on the banks of the River Niger, near the bridge, in the fishery zones of Markala and in Niono (Dora), and of ice in Seribala and Dougabougou. The fish, whether fresh, fried, smoked or dried, will be sold in Bamako, at the Castle Market in Ségou and on location in Markala, for cash and seldom on credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They have at their disposal in their backyards traditional specialized ovens and dryers to smoke and dry their fish.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 60,500 CFA francs (US$138). They will save this money to buy freezers, to help their husbands to buy fishery material, to pay their children’s school fees and the small household expenses, in particular soap and clothing. Their ambition is to own, each of them, a freezer to bring down their expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 35-year-old engaged man. He has been the owner of a car painting shop since 1994, with 20 years of experience in this market. There is great demand for his shop's work – that's the reason he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase materials such as paint and some tools.

loans.use: To purchase paint and tools

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz S. lives in the village of Prk Malipayon, Brgy Sagasa, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She is 48 years old and is married to Jerry S., who works as a farmer. She has 8 children; one already has his own family, and the rest are still attending school. As a mother, she would like to secure the future of her children by making sure that they have very good jobs and enough earnings to support the needs of their own families when they decide to settle down. 

Ma. Luz got married at only 19 years old because she wanted to be free of her parents' strictness. When she had her own family, she encountered a lot of hardships and problems on how to cope with their daily living. She knew that her husband's income as a farmer was not enough for them. When their first baby was born, Ma. Luz tried other ways to earn other income like putting up a small general store at the front of her house while raising ducks in her backyard. In spite of the additional business, they still encountered problems; still, they persevered.   

In 2001 Ma. Luz was able to join NWTF-Project Dungganon, which gave her additional capital for their business. With the loan, she was able to buy additional ducks to raise so that she could then sell the eggs to their neighbors. As loans continued, she learned how to handle her money. She was also able to invest in pig fattening, acquire a farmland and buy a water buffalo for their farm. Twenty six years later, Ma.Luz is more knowledgeable on how to manage her businesses. She now earns PHP 10,000 per month. Most of the profit is put in a savings account to support the education of their children and to help with the family expenses.

For her previous loan, Ma. Luz borrowed PHP 13,000. Said loan was paid in full and on time. Now, while on her 18th cycle, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the money to buy additional ducks to raise and egg trays for the delivery of eggs. The resulting income will be used to improve her family's living conditions, pay for her children's education and renovate her house.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: purchasing additional ducks to raise

loans.name: Benson Nyaoge

texts.en: Benson is 32 years old and married with two children. He sells new and secondhand clothing, as well as chickens and fresh eggs.
