Mrs.Yov P. would like to open a grocery store to service her community and generate more income for her household. However; she faces a financial crisis. To do so, she is requesting a loan amount of $1000 to help her build her store and purchase grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Mr. B. is an embroidery tailor in Thiès, he is married and the father of two children who he is responsible for; he has rich experience in this business and works with three male apprentices and a young woman. He specializes in all sewing styles and would like to have a loan to pay for another sewing machine and to purchase some materials to meet his orders.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr B. est un tailleur broderie à Thiès, il est marié et père de deux enfants à charge; il a une riche experience dans cette activité et travaille avec trois apprentis garçons et une jeune fille. Il est spécialisé dans la couture tous genre et voudrait disposer d' un pret pour se payer une autre machine et acheter quelques matières pour satisfaire les commandes.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine to complete orders

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18, 14 and 8 years old.Winnie keeps livestock, and she started in 2005. Every day, she works on her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia O. is a fashion designer and she also sells clothes. She acquired the skill over a 2 year-period and has been in business since 2003. Antonia is 25 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Antonia has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Now she is requesting a loan of $425 to buy more clothing inventory. She thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Koffi Mensah

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Mensah D. was born on August 24, 1979 in Agou gadzépé, which is situated 100 km from Lomé. He is married and the father of two children. He is a gardener by trade but he has opened a telephone booth in the Adidogomé neighborhood. At his booth, he also sells rechargeable phone cards. This first credit that he is requesting will allow him to buy a little box of rechargeable phone cards and to get a second telephone for the booth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur D. Koffi Mensah est né le 24 août 1979 à Agou gadzépé, localité située à 100Km de Lomé. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il est jardinier de profession mais a ouvert une cabine téléphonique dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Dans sa cabine, il vend aussi des cartes de recharge. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter un petit carton de cartes de recharge et d’acquérir un second combiné téléphonique.

loans.use:
Purchase of rechargeable cards

Achat de carte de recharges

loans.name: Chamruen

texts.en: Mrs. Chamruen T. is 51 years old and lives in Makak Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Cheang Phang, are farmers. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The remaining two are attending school. Mrs. Chamruen T.’s house does not have a kitchen so she must cook under the house, which makes it difficult for her to prepare good food for her family. That is why she decided to apply for a loan to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To build a kitchen to cook food for her household.

loans.name: Amela

texts.en: Amela is 20 years old and lives with her husband in the town Banovići.  She works as a hairdresser, and she earns about 400 KM. This is her first loan in the amount of 600 KM. Amela will use it to buy new hairdressing tools in order to start her own business at home.  She plans to save the money and use it to open her own hairdressing salon.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools to open her own salon

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Mr. Lem L. (picture with his wife and vegetables), 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sarun Hul, 43, live along National Road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have three children: one daughter and two sons. One son is married and lives outside the family home, and the other son is a mason. Their daughter is a garment factory worker.

Mr. Lem and his wife have been farming since 1986. They grow vegetables to sell to the middle man in the village. Besides the farming business, Lem is also a fisherman. He has been fishing since 1984 and selling fish in the village. Currently, the couple wants to expand their farm but lacks the money. 

Therefore, Lem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase seed, fertilizer to plant vegetables, and bamboo and net to sheathe plants from the sun.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and bamboo and net to sheathe plants from the sun

loans.name: Rosita Miksy

texts.es:
La señora Rosita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, ubicado en la calle 22 Mz. 30 Lt. 5 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vigilante de seguridad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Viene trabajando 3 años con el Banco Comunal. 

En la actualidad  se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cuenta con un galpón de crianza de pollos en el Km 60. De Lunes a Viernes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a la venta de su negocio, Sábados y Domingos administra la crianza de pollos.   
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas y 200 pollitos.  

Rosita y su familia se sienten muy felices por la ayuda que recibe del Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Rosita belongs to the communal bank "Las Doncellas” located at calle 22 Mz. 30 Lt. 5 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa in Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 28 years old and has two young children whom she needs to support. Rosita is married, her husband works as a security guard. She decided to invest the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for three years.

At the moment Rosita sells soft drinks and has of a chicken shed where she breeds chicken at Km 60. From Monday to Friday she attends her children and her business while she manages the breeding of chicken on Saturdays and Sundays.

She will purchase 10 crates of soft drinks and 200 chicks with the present loan of 2000 soles. This amount will be paid back in 5 months.

Rosita and her family are very happy for the help they receive from the communal bank of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow their field.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mrs. Phen P. was born in 1974 and lives in Krodas Khor village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice for a living. On her plantation, she now has an obstacle because her soil is infertile which affects her crop. To deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the field and make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Koeurn Kan, is a palm juice collector who gathers the juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Mrs. Phen P. is 34-years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one stays at home. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field to make her rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.fr: Gloria D., 32 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Gloria veut renforcer sa boutique en produits alimentaires (riz, boissons et divers. Elle a la charge de la scolarité de sa fille et participe aux charges familiales. Cette activité va lui permettre d’améliorer ses conditions de vie  et de faciliter l’accès à certains produits à la population de son village natal  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Gloria D., 32 years old, is married and cares for three children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Peyrissac village bank for seven and a half years. Gloria wants to stock her store with food such as rice and refreshments among other items. She is responsible for the cost of sending her daughter to school and contributes to the household expenses. This business will allow her to improve her living conditions and bring certain products to the people of her hometown. She is asking for this loan which will be repaid in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products (rice, refreshments, etc) to stock her store.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Doña Socorro vende prendas de oro laminado que es lo que hoy día se vende más, pues las jóvenes lo usan bastante por su buena calidad y son de costos accesibles, pues la da al contado y al crédito en dos pagos, negocio que lleva seis años, que inicio con prestamos y ha ido creciendo pues compra variedad de prendas, con esta solicitud lo quiere es comprar bastante prendas para ofertar a sus clientes y buscar otros mercado donde pueda vender. La sra. Socorro tiene 48 años de edad, sus hijos están mayores, su esposo no vive ya en casa, pues tiene que esforzarse a vender para subsistir con su familia, pero gracias a Dios tiene el apoyo de sus hijos que le aportan económicamente. Sus planes es poder seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Socorro sells gold-plated jewelry as that is what sells best these days: young people like it because of its good quality and its reasonable price. She sells both for cash and on credit to be repaid in two instalments. She has had this business for six years. She started her business thanks to loans and it has continued to grow. She buys a variety of items. She will use this loan to buy a large amount of jewelry to offer to her customers and to look for new markets in which to sell. Socorro is 48 years old, her children are grown and her husband is not currently living at home. She has to work hard selling in order for her family to survive, but thanks to God she has her children's financial support. She plans to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of jewelry and expand her business.

loans.name: Naziran M.asghar Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is a 57 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is M. Asghar, who has been a vegetable seller for the past 4 years. Naziran baji is the mother of one son, named Abbas ali, and he is a driver by profession. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naziran baji is an old lady so she spends most of her time doing household work. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy bicycles to sell. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy blankets to sell. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: El Sr. Eugenio S. M. quinces años que vive por esta zona, el es nacido en Montero de Santa Cruz, ahora vive en este lugar llamado Jardín de las delicias con su esposa la Sra. Lidia Arias Chávez y sus tres hijos, la actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, con la cual mantiene a su familia, generalmente se dedica a la siembra de maní, maíz, y arroz. El cuenta con una parcela en este lugar de 38 hras. De tierra en la que ahora debido a la época quiere sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Eugenio S. M. has been living in this region for the past 15 years. He was born in Montero de Santa Cruz but now lives in the region called Jardin de las Delicias with his wife Mrs. Lidia Arias Chavez and their three children. His occupation is agriculture, through which he supports his family. Generally he cultivates chickpeas, maize, and rice. He has a plot of land of 38 hectares in this region. He now plans on starting a potato plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeding potatoes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. Susan is 35 years old and is married; her husband is a policeman. She has 3 children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Salome Donatilda

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Salome es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Salome tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija. Además Salome tiene un carro con el cual su esposo realiza transporte de pasajeros a diferentes distritos de la región.
Salome necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños de Salome son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ahorrar para el futuro y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Salome is a member of the Bienestar communal bank. She is married, 42 years old and has 3 children. Salome has a store in her house in which she sells groceries, such as vegetables, meat, etc. with the help of her daughter. In addition, Salome has a car that her husband uses to transport passengers to various districts in the region. Salome needs a loan of 2100 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil. Salome's dreams are that her children become professionals, saving money for the future and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Kurbonmahmad

texts.ru: Хазраткулов Курбонмахмад живет в районе Хуросон. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Один сын работает в России и присылает оттуда деньги. Курбонмахмад 27 лет работал шофером. В данный момент у него имеется собственный, продуктовый магазин.Этим видом бизнеса клиент занимается более 5 лет. Курбонмахмад хочет получить от нас кредит, чтобы купить товары с города Душанбе и перепродать их в Хуросоне. На полученный доход он еще хочет увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Kurbonmahmad H. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 53 years old, married and has 6 children. One of his sons works in Russia and sends money home. Kurbonmahmad worked as a driver for 27 years and now owns a food market. He has been in this business over 5 years. Kurbonmahmad wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase products from Dushanbe and resell them in Khuroson. He wants to use the resulting profit to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Badeya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier N’kola de la sous-préfecture de Fakola (région de Sikasso, république du Mali)
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parentés et de voisinage. Elles font entre autre l’achat et la vente d’articles divers, la restauration etc depuis 5 ans. Elles ont une très bonne réputation est connue  de  tous dans le secteur. 
Suite à la croissance du nombre de leur clientèle, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 300kg de riz, des tubercules (100kg de pomme de terre, 50kg d’igname, 50kg de patate douce), 100kg de poissons fumés ou séchés, 50 paquets de cube maggi et 50kg de sel de cuisine. Elles s’approvisionnent dans le marché de Fakola auprès des forains et effectuent leurs ventes, aux forains, aux voyageurs, aux ménagères et revendeurs des villages environnants.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt, le reste ajouté au fonds de commerce.
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Badeya are married women who average 32 years of age and 2 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the N’kola district of the sub-prefecture of Fakola (region of Sikasso, Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship and community. Their businesses have included the buying and selling of various goods, food catering, etc. for five years. The women have a very good reputation and are known by everyone in their fields of business. Following the growth in the number of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy 300 kg of rice, some tubers (100 kg of potatoes, 50 kg of yams, 50 kg of sweet potatoes), 100 kg of smoked or dried fish, 50 packets of Maggi cubes, and 50 kg of salt. Supplies are procured at the Fakola marketplace from fair vendors. Sales are made to fair vendors, travelers, housewives, and retailers of the surrounding villages. The group members each hope to realize a profit of 35,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to repay the loan, and the rest will augment their working capital. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other income-generating work, such as selling cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and condiments for the restaurant business

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 29 years old and married to Bonifacio.They are blessed with three children. Ligaya is a God-fearing person and also teaches her children the words of God.

Ligaya manages a little vending stall in their village selling snacks and some vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 4,000 as additional business capital. This will make her business progressive in the coming days as she generates funds for the education of her three children. Ligaya also wants their living situation to someday be alleviated from poverty and she believes that the lenders will play a big role in achieving her dreams in life.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Sere Pou Choche Group

texts.en:
The Sere Pou Choche Bank of Hope is made of 20 male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their first loan they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses with their second loan. There are five members of the Bank of Hope that will not be taking out another loan.

Delcame P. is one of four representatives of the group. He is a happily married father of two small children. The hardworking family man works with his wife to buy used clothing and footwear in the big city to sell in the rural areas. He often works with his wife to monitor the selling while he is able to purchase in the city, thus allowing the business to always be operating. He admits that times have been tough but the loan was a blessing. He says sending his six-year-old son to school is easier and even though the meals his family eats aren’t extravagant, they are consistent. He attributes the recent development in the area to the presence of Esperanza’s work in the area.

On behalf of Sere Pou Choche, Delcame, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothes in bulk, including sneakers, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor Y. is from the village of Danao. She is 40 years old. Flor is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Flor operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Flor has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $104) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Flor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Flor is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Flor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar R. T. es un señor de 74 años de edad, vecino de  una comunidad  rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Don Omar vive con su esposa y con su hijo de 15 años. 

Desde muy joven don Omar se ha dedicado a la siembra de café, tiene 1 ½  manzanas de café el cual trabaja solo ya que su hijo estudia, también, se dedica a la corta de césped en jardines y zonas verdes de su comunidad. Dice que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Actualmente don Omar requiere un préstamo de ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones) para comprar una máquina para cortar césped. Con esta espera agilizar y facilitar su trabajo.

Don Omar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 5 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente.
texts.en:
Omar R. T. is 74 and lives in a rural community in Costa Rica, which is located 45 kilometers south of San Jose. It is called San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal is a little mountainous and has economic activities like growing vegetables, coffee and other things; craftwork; livestock; and many other activities. Omar lives with his wife and his 15-year-old son. Since he was very young, he has grown coffee. He has 2.5 acres to grow coffee on where he works alone since his son goes to school. He also mows grass in yards and green space in his community. He says that thanks to this business, his family's quality of life has improved considerably. He currently needs a loan of 300,000 colones to buy a lawn mower. With this, he hopes to make his work faster and easier. Omar is a member of the communal bank, "San Cristobal Norte," one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. He has received 5 microcredits, which is has paid back responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lawn mower

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es separado tiene 3 hijas que viven con él, sus hijas ya son mayores de edad., todas trabajan con él en el negocio de la familia
         El se dedica a la venta de gaseosas en el micro centro, para dicha actividad le fabricaron unos carritos para la venta de gaseosas, vende solamente las gaseosas personales ya que son muy accesibles al público y la de mayor demanda en la zona. 
      Se inicio con un pequeño capital que tenía guardado de un trabajo que realizaba anteriormente, un amigo le fabrico los carritos. 
        El crédito solicitado va invertir en la compra de botellas ya que para el verano las ventas aumentan. 
        El demostró ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel is separated and has three daughters that live with him. His daughters are already adults. They all work with him at his family business. He sells soft drinks at a small market. To do this, they made little carts to sell their soft drinks. He only sells single-serving soft drinks since they are very accessible to the public and have the biggest demand in the region. He started with a small amount of capital that he had saved from a job he used to have. A friend made the carts for him. He will invest the requested credit in the purchase of bottles since his sales increase during the summer. He has proven himself to be a very hard-working and responsible person with his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bottles for soft drinks

loans.name: Myrnaflor

texts.en:
Like any mother, Myrnaflor D. dreams of a bright future for her children. She has seven children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old,  and a very supportive husband who helps her manage her rice field. She hopes that her rice can provide for her family's basic needs, such as food, clothing and school supplies.

She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and to pay the laborer who helped them till their rice field. 

Receiving this loan will enable her family to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 29 year old father of one who runs a pharmacy in Kangemi, Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last two years after working in a pharmacy. He is requesting for a loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to add stock of medicine. He hopes to open more outlets in other regions to serve more Kenyans and start selling medicine wholesale. He describes himself as successful and hardworking.

About Kiva's partner Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: Melida es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 45 años, madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, Melida  es costurera y también se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, néctares y refrescos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la compra-venta de productos regionales. Forma parte del Banco Comunal ”Mujeres Trabajadoras” desde hace nueve años,  el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 que lo invirtió en productos para su bodega, pues antes se dedicaba a este negocio, en la actualidad Melida  necesita un crédito de 2500 soles que será utilizado  una parte para comprar telas, botones, hilos, elásticos, para la confección de blusas y otra parte será invertido en la compra de bebidas. La meta de Melida es tener un taller de costura bien implementado para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melinda is a hard-working, active woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and the mother of two adult children. She is a seamstress but also sells soft drinks, fruit juices, and other beverages. Her husband, who works in sales of regional products, supports her work. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" communal bank for the last 9 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy stock for her store for she used to have a grocery store. Currently, Melinda needs a 2500 sol loan part of which will be used to buy fabric, buttons, thread and elastic which she will use to sew blouses and the other part will be used to buy beverages. Melinda's goal is to have a well-equipped clothes-making shop from which to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part to purchase fabric, buttons, thread and elastic for use in sewing blouses and part to buy beverages.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 35 years old and married with four children. He runs a butchery and also earns some income through small-scale farming. He is requesting a loan for Kes. 40,000 to buy cattle for slaughter. He has successfully completed two loans through Faulu in the past.
He describes himself as confident and determined and hopes to expand his business to be a wholesale distributor of meat.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy cattle for slaughter

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin A. lives in Brgy 3, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 46 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom have already graduated from college as nurses. She is working hard for the future of her three remaining children whom they continue to send to school. Jasmin started her business by baking foods like pastries and cakes. It is a trade she learned years ago and discovered that she has the knack for. She started selling these foods to her community and other neighboring villages. She also accepted orders for her baked goods. But in the year 2001, she needed additional capital to buy ingredients for her business so that she could accommodate all the orders. Luckily, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to address her need of additional capital. She was able to buy ingredients so she could meet all her deadlines for the orders.

As her loan continued, she also started a cross-stitch business. With the knowledge she acquired on how to do cross-stitch, she was able to make beautiful, neat and clean products. The new business has contributed to her income. For the two businesses, she is able to earn about $220 a month. She saves most of her income to support the education of her children and the rest is used to support the needs of her family. A previous loan of 27,000 PHP was used as additional working capital for her baked products and cross-stitch businesses. Because of her success, she was able to maintain her good credit performance with NWTF-Project Dungganon. She was able to pay off the loan in full and on time. Now on her 16th cycle loan, with the same amount of 27,000 PHP, Jasmin will buy additional materials for her cross-stitch and baked goods businesses. Whatever income she gets will be used for the education of her children. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy materials for her cross-stitch & baking businesses

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret raises chickens to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profit during this season. She is 55 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. She has been in this business for a long time. She sells for long hours to meet the basic needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: B. Pélagie est née en 1969 au Bénin. Pélagie est une divorcée, et mère de deux enfants. Les deux enfants sont scolarisés. Pélagie vit seule avec ses enfants à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pélagie n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Pélagie vend de la friperie au marché Houègbo et à Calavi, non loin de Cotonou. Pélagie s'approvisionne à Missèbo, un marché de friperies situé à Cotonou au Bénin. Pélagie a 10 ans d'expérience dans ce métier, et a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé. Pélagie a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu'elle a obtenus de ALIDé. Dans l'optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité afin de se faire une épargne, Pélagie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Pélagie B. was born in 1969 in Benin. Pélagie is a divorced mother of two children. Both children went to school. Pélagie lives alone with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Pélagie did not go to school. To meet her needs, Pélagie sells used clothing at the Houègbo market and at Calavi, not far from Cotonou. Pélagie gets her supplies at Missèbo, the use clothing market located in Cotonou, Benin. Pélagie has 10 years of experience in this business, and has already received two loans from ALIDé. Pélagie repaid both loans that she received from ALIDé. In order to further increase her business activity for the purpose of accumulating some savings, Pélagie is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Bruce Popp, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Bales of Used Clothing

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been selling good quality furniture since 2001. Mohammad is successful in his work because he does his best to offer his customers what they want and tries hard to meet their requests. He also has good experience in sales. His customers are people from his region.
Mohammad set up his business because he had experience. He is an active man who does his best to improve his work and increase his income. He requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new furniture for his business – for example, he wants to start selling desks with chairs. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his shop by expanding his range of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for his business

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndella D. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 3 ans et a eu 6 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle soutien son mari dans la pris en charge de la famille par rapport à la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Ndella D. is a 55-year-old married mother of 7 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 3 years and has had 6 previous loan experiences. She raises cattle. She supports her husband in providing for the family's food and health needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her business

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mrs. El R. and her husband, Mr. Nos Him, are dried fish sellers. They both always go to sell their produces around the province in Cambodia, and are able to earn about $10 a day. The family takes care of six school-aged kids and three others who are married and employed. El R. lives with her family in the Bei Village in the Chrung Chumres I Sangkat in Phnom Penh City. Because of her business, she can help her children go to school and pay her family’s living expenses. El R. has requested a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old and married with five children aged between 15 and 25 years. All her children go to school. The family owns a two-room house where she stays with eight people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and feeding the family. Margaret owns a stall where she sells charcoal in Makerere Kikoni and she is a policewoman attached to Kawempe police station. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over 12 years. She incurs transport costs to and from buying sacks of charcoal from suppliers in Kawempe. Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season because she works from a muddy and open place.  She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over 10 years, taking her 20th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start selling at wholesale only.
.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 44-year-old man, married and blessed with two children who attend school. He sells construction materials to builders and to other hardware shops. He has been running this business for 10 years and he has one employee to assist him in the business.  He was previously employed in a butcher shop before he ventured into this business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He hopes to grow his business and build a house for his family in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to buy cement. He describes himself as focused and a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy cement

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann manages a sari-sari (variety) store and at the same time runs a 2-hectare rice field. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it helps a lot in sustaining her businesses. With its low interest charge, it helps finance her businesses well.

She is 36 years old and living in Norala, South Cotabato. The eldest of her four children is 14 years old. She hopes for a brighter future for them.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Jelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jelyn M. is from the village of Minlasag, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 36 years old. Jelyn is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

Jelyn is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, particularly in hog raising. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pigs. Jelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for the business. Jelyn is requesting a new loan of 16,500 PHP which will be used for house renovation. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House Renovation.

loans.name: Yeke

texts.en:
Yeke D. is from the village of Salvaion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 38 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Yeke has a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Yeke has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Yeke joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase needed materials. Yeke is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the third loan taken out by Yeke from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services offered

loans.name: Narynbaeva's Group

texts.en:
Generally, by means of TV channels and newspapers, we obtain an opportunity to learn how the economy is developing and how the whole country is growing. Regarding the lives of individuals, however, there is little information available. So, the only way to learn is to consider our own lives and look at the lives of the people surrounding us. The general economic state of each country is estimated from all these lives. 

Our heroes (these group members) represent the multiplicity of any population. N. is fifty-five years old. She is a widow. She and her husband were happy enough, as they were endowed with six children. Most of these children are grownups, and not only make their own living, but also actively support N. in her old age. 

Her eldest daughter is married and works in Afghanistan, on American military bases. Her second daughter is married and works in Russia. The other two daughters are working in the capital city of Bishkek. Two of her sons are living with her. The elder one works for the local municipality. The younger son is fifteen and goes to school.

N. keeps a cow, and does some household work. Her sons help her in their free time. N. decided to apply for this loan to buy a refrigerator. 

N.’s partners: 

T. Esentaeva, 39, is married and has a twelve-year-old son. Her husband works in construction. T. is occupied with raising cattle, and intends to buy more calves to increase the total population. Therefore, this loan is very important to her. 

N. Imatova, 49, is a widow. She has a twenty-year-old son. He goes to college. N. is occupied with cattle breeding and this brings her a monthly income of about $110. N. needs this loan to purchase more cows or calves. She hopes that in the near future she will be able to buy her son a car. 

N. Otorov, 30, is the father of two little kids. His wife stays at home with the children. N. is the sole provider. He works as a taxi driver. N. hopes to obtain this loan because he is planning to purchase calves. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 61 year old married lady with six children. In the past ten years, she has been selling hair products. Besides the hair products, she does dairy farming and sells eggs to earn a living. She works hard to educate her children, who are still in school. She hopes to see her children through university levels in their studies. She joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Thuina Victory with the aim of saving money and accessing financial resources (loans). The group members guarantee each other's loans. She has requested for a loan of KES30, 000 to buy a dairy cow. She hopes to add more than five cows to her farm and to build a permanent shop for selling milk and eggs in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en:
Vorng S., 31, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

Morn weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of about USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to produce more silk products to sell

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang N. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. elle est membre du banc Villageois de SANKAGNE 2 depuis le 31 mai 2007 et y a bénéficié de 05 crédit qu'elle a gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce et son prêt lui permettra de faire un renforcement d'activité en achetant plus de marchandises telles des tissus, des voiles et des chaussures. Les bénéfices générés lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille par exemple la nourriture, la santé et l'habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
Mbayang N. is a married, 30 year-old woman who is responsible for four children. She has been a member of the SANKAGNE 2 Banc Villageois since May 31, 2007. She has received five loans and has repaid them properly.She has a small business. Her loan will allow her to buy more items like fabrics, veils and shoes to improve her business. The revenues will allow her to financially contribute to meeting family expenses such as food, health and clothing for the children.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her revenue-generating business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 66 years old and is married with four adult children. Maria owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She also grows hogs to fatten them for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years. Maria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell plus feed for her pigs. This loan will be her seventh from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell plus feed for her pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Novyi Rozdil, Stryi region. She sells print press in one of the local markets in her home town. Marina offers a variety of newspapers and magazines at affordable prices. She has been in this business for 12 years. Presently, Marina has 3,000 UAH invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 1,410 UAH per month.
Marina is a reliable borrower. She works hard to make her living and she likes to keep moving on. She is hoping to see her business grow in the future. One of her main goals is to open additional vending locations stocked with printed press inventory. Marina's merchandise sells well in Ukraine where people buy newspapers and magazines on a regular basis. She is seeking a loan of 3,000 UAH to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny B. is from the village of Talic Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Jenny is married. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods like shampoo, toothpaste, and rice. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jenny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jenny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jenny is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which she will use to expand her business. This loan will be Jenny's sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to enable them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mirna Yaneth

texts.es: Mirna Yaneth P. T. de 26 años de edad, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la cual vela por el bienestar de su pequeña hija de dos años de edad, junto a la cual vive en el municipio de Soyapango. Mirna posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa carne de res y de pollo, así mismo chorizos, salchichas y otros derivados, desde hace 6 años que ella trabaja de esta manera, y por brindar un excelente servicio y calidad de sus productos, ella cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales le compran semanalmente sus productos. Mirna solicita un préstamo con la intención de poder comprar mayor cantidad de carne de res y así también chorizos, salchichas, chuletas y otros derivados más, lo que más desea Mirna es el poder mejorar sus ganancias, ya que ella espera brindarle una vida mejor a su pequeño hijo, el cual depende únicamente de ella para salir adelante y contar con todo lo necesario como estudios y vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirna Yaneth P. T. is 26 years old and a hard working enterprising single mother who works long hours for the well being of her two year old daughter. They live in the city of Soyapango. Mirna has a business where she sells beef and chicken, as well as sausages, franks, and other meat products. She’s been doing this for six years and has many customers who buy from her regularly each week, thanks to the excellent service she provides. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a large quantity of beef, chicken, sausages, franks, chops, and other meat products. What she desires the most is to increase her income so that she can give her young child a better life. She is her only means of support and her sole provider of a home, education and means to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meats

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth D. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by running a Sari- Sari (general) Store, Food Vending and beauty products sales.  She lives in Locatha, Brgy. Looc, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since March 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, food vending and beauty products businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Lilibeth is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lilibeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda D. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling rice and Ready-To-Wear clothes. She lives in Paraiso Proper, Brgy. Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Yolanda is now borrowing 22,000 PHP so that she can continue to fund her business operations. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Yolanda hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Santa Rosa in the municipality of Gamu, Isabela province on the islands of Luzon. Marites raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her pigs.

In 2008, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. Marites is requesting a new loan, her fifth from ASKI, of 12,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Zipporah Muthoni

texts.en:
Zipporah has been selling charcoal in Naivasha for the last three years. She is 30 years old, married to Peter M. and they have three children. 

Zipporah was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time. She plans to use this second loan to buy three sacks of charcoal and add fruits for resale. With these two businesses she forsees more profits and thus a better standard of living for her and her family.

Zipporah is a hardworking and ambitious lady.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of charcoal and also fruits for sale

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 48-year-old father with four children who is married to Lucy. For the past 17 years, Jeremiah’s primary business has been running a dairy and crop farming. Jeremiah lives in Kiambu, which is a relatively productive area that receives a good amount of rainfall every season making it favorable for agricultural activities.

Jeremiah got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his second loan with KADET and he has also previously borrowed from other institutions. With this loan, Jeremiah plans to buy a water pump and irrigation pipes. He also plans to have electricity installed in his farm.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and irrigation pipes and to install electricity

loans.name: Beatrice Ngina

texts.en:
Beatrice Ngina K., aged 38, runs a green grocery shop at Mlolongo Market, which is a busy market. She is married to Joseph Kioko.  The couple has  one son, who is 12 years old and in Form One. Beatrice was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET client.

Beatrice has been running her business for three years, and her monthly income is 26,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). This is her second loan from KADET.  She plans to use the loan to open another shop for selling fruits and vegetables. She hopes to save the income to fulfill her longstanding dream of buying a piece of land to build her home and rental houses.

Beatrice describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To open another shop to sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a vegetable selling business at the market, selling to her neighboring community and passersby. Margaret faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and diversify in the future.  

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will provide a boost to her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Arnoldo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Arnoldo H., es agricultor, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la Comarca El Coyolito en Estelí, casado y tiene 2 hijos; con mas 20 anos de experiencia en este sector. Inicio su experiencia ayudando a sus padres a sembrar frijoles y con los bueyes, a la corta edad de 8 años, en sus tiempos libres, usualmente cuando regresaba de la escuela.
Desafortunadamente según el expresa, sus padres nunca le dieron verdadera importancia a los Estudios, por lo que los abandono a los 18 anos de edad y se caso; Desde entonces, se dedico solamente a la agricultura, en sociedad con un amigo, se dedicaron especialmente a la siembra de frijoles y hortalizas tales como Cebolla y Chiltoma y un poco de Tomate; estas cosechas le permitieron obtener su casita y algunas herramientas agrícolas.
Su Esposa horna 2 veces a la semana y estos ingresos ayudan un poco con parte de los gastos de la casa y de los hijos.
El esta realizando este préstamo, para comprar algunos insumos, ya que según el, de esta manera su producción será mas eficiente.
De la ganancia obtenida en esta cosecha, a el le gustaría ampliar  su área de siembra, mejorar un poco su casita y ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en: Mr Arnoldo H., a farmer, is 36 and lives in the El Coyolito Region in Esteli. He is married and has 2 children. He has over 20 years' experience in agriculture. He began helping his parents at the young age of 8 in his free time, normally when he would come home from school. He would help to plant beans and with the oxen. Unfortunately, he says, his parents never truly valued education, and he abandoned his studies at the age of 18 and got married. Since then, he has worked exclusively in agriculture, with a friend. They sow beans and vegetables such as onions, sweet peppers and some tomatoes. These harvests have allowed him to obtain his home and some agricultural tools. His wife bakes twice a week, and the income from this helps a little with part of the household costs and the costs of maintaining their children. He is taking out this loan to purchase some agricultural inputs, which according to him will make his production more efficient. With the earnings from this harvest, he would like to expand his sowing area, improve his home a little and help his daughter with her studies.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural inputs

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy Z. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 34 years old. Teddy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Teddy owns and operates a service-based business, providing photocopying services in the local community. Teddy has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $460 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teddy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teddy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. 

Teddy is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 4th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn N. is from the village of Naggasican, Santiago City. She is 41 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana R. de 62 años es una mujer muy fuerte y emprendedora, que con su negocio de fabricación de productos alimenticios como deditos, empanaditas, arepas y pastelitos de queso, carne , o pollo, a los que imprime el sabor de la comida de su natal Cartagena,  ha logrado sostener   su hogar; Ana  llegó de su tierra desde sus 7 años a Barranquilla, ciudad capital,  donde hizo estudios primarios, contrajo matrimonio, tuvo 8 hijos y finalmente se separó de su esposo  e inició su propio negocio, que  al principio   fue la  preparación de fritos en su propia casa, actividad que  cambió por la de panadería , con la que se posicionó por muchos años en el mercado y construyó su legado familiar en este oficio, pues  todos sus hijos en las edades de 25 a 38 años tienen su propia microempresa en panadería, o en preparación de productos derivados de la harina de trigo. 
Hoy  su principal actividad es la fabricación de deditos, pastelitos, empanaditas de queso, pollo o carne, los cuales distribuye en los colegios de los barrios aledaños a su vivienda y en tiendas donde es muy reconocida. Su meta principal es diversificar sus productos y la apertura de nuevos y permanentes mercados y este es justamente su gran desafío.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante la línea credikiva, ya que su capital de trabajo es muy pequeño y quiere fortalecerlo comprando, materias primas de contado para obtener descuentos por el volumen de compra, especialmente Harina de trigo, y azúcar, que aumentan sus precios permanentemente. El negocio de Ana en este momento presenta una Rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 1,3 días, una rotación de inventarios de 5 días, mientras su  rotación de cuentas por pagar es de 2, 5 días y su endeudamiento con el nuevo credikiva es de 11,20%. Ana Isabel es una gran madre que ha apoyado siempre a sus hijos y en la actualidad ellos la poyan también,  por eso su sueño es verlos realizados y con vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Ana R., age 62, is a very strong and enterprising woman.  She makes food products like deditos (a type of fried snack); empanaditas (little turnovers); corn cakes; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies.  She makes them with the flavor of food in her native Cartagena.  She has managed to support her household.

Ana left her land and arrived in Barranquilla, the capital city, seven years ago.  She attended elementary school, got married, and had eight children.  She eventually separated from her husband and started her own business.

At the beginning she made fried food in her own house.  She traded that activity for a bakery, which has been located in the market for many years.  She built her family legacy through this occupation.  All of her children, ages 25-38, have their own small bakery businesses or make products derived from wheat flour.

Now she primarily makes deditos; corn cakes; cheese, meat, or chicken empanaditas; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies.  She distributes them to the schools in the neighborhoods surrounding her house.  She also delivers to stores where she is very well-known.

Her main goal is to diversify her products and to open new and permanent markets.  This is precisely her great challenge.

She is currently applying for her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through Kiva.  She has very little work capital, and she wants to strengthen it by purchasing raw materials for cash.  She will do this to get volume discounts, especially for wheat flour and sugar.  These prices are constantly rising.

Ana’s business now has a turnover on accounts receivable of 1.3 days, a 5 day turnover of inventory, and its turnover for accounts payable is 2.5 days.  Her debt with the new Kiva loan is 11.2%.

Ana is a great mother who has always supported her children.  Now, they support her as well.  Therefore, her dream is to see them become successful and have their own homes.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Manuela, tiene 57 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre y dos hermanas. El negocio de ella es la venta de tostadas, enchiladas y mariscos, este comenzó con el apoyo de su madre y hermanas, quienes hasta el momento le ayudan a atenderlo, no tiene un horario fijo de atención, pero cuenta con una larga experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales como plátanos, yuca, bolsas plásticas, ya que son los necesarios para atender a los clientes, esta inversión será una gran ayuda que le permitirá continuar trabajando y generando ingresos para su familia.
Doña manuela aspira mejorar la atención a la clientela, aumentando la producción y realizar los alimentos cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Manuela is 57 years old and she lives in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her mother and her two sisters. She sells tostadas, enchiladas, and seafood. She started out with the support of her mother and sisters who until now have been helping her run the business. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule and she has many years' experience.

She requests a loan to purchase ingredients such as bananas, yucca, and plastic bags. These are necessary to attend her clients. This investment will be a great help because it will permit her to keep working and generating an income for her family. 

Manuela aspires to provide her clientele with better service by increasing production and preparing her foods every day a little better.

loans.use: To purchase bananans, yucca, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 36 years old. Her husband’s name is M. and he has a power loom business. He operates his business from his home and it is going well for him. Because of his experience of 18 years in his business, he receives a good number of orders every month and they earn him regular income. Shahnaz also helps her husband in his business, when M. goes out of home to collect orders. Shahnaz operates his power loom machine for preparing bed sheets.

She is also a very good mother and takes care of her children very well. She has enrolled them into school and they are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy thread to prepare larger quantity of bed sheets which will help him to complete larger orders on-time and to earn better profits. Shahnaz is very confident that the loan investment will help him earn better profits and she will be able to live a better standard of living with her family as a result.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her s econdloan application. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time.

She lives in Kasur which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan which is famous for its leather industry. She lives there in a small home which contains two rooms in the area of Bhutta sohan din.

loans.use: To buy thread for bed sheets-making business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina P. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Cristina is married and has nine adult children. 

To make a living, Cristina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, beverages, powdered juice, shampoo, soap and biscuits. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory for working capital. 

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and biscuits. This will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and biscuits

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tobacco sales business. She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of tobacco to offer for sale. Brigida has been in this business for 25 years. She earns additional income from tablea and handwoven (banig) making.

Brigida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to expand her business in order to support the family needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of tobacco to offer for sale

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 60 años, vive con una de sus hijas en su casa que es propia. Hace  más de 6 años vende mazamorras, postre típico de su zona, y que actualmente lo ofrece en un puesto que estableció hace 4 años. Es así que atiende desde la mañana hasta llegada la noche. Durante la semana se da el tiempo suficiente para abastecerse de mercadería para continuar con la preparación de éste postre. Ante el buen gusto de preparar mazamorras  y el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, le ha favorecido en las ventas, es por eso  que se proyecta a elaborar en mayor proporción mazamorra. Es su crédito número 15  que tiene con MFP,  considera que su experiencia de trabajo que ha realizado en su banco comunal es muy positiva ya que significó para ella un espacio de aprendizaje y agradece ese apoyo comprometiéndose a seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Genoveva, age 60, lives with one of her daughters in her own house. For over six years, she has been selling mazamorras -- a typical dessert in her area (a sweet corn-based pudding). She currently sells them from morning till night from a vending post that she has installed four years ago. During the week, she has enough time to replenish her stock of ingredients necessary for the preparation of this dessert.

Genoveva's skill in preparing manzamorras and the good service she offers to her clients have allowed her to grow her sales; it is for this reason that she plans to make manzamorras in greater quantity. 

This is Genoveva's 15th credit with MFP, and she feels that her experience as part of the communal bank has been very positive, given that it gave her a space where she could learn new things.
