Ludith is a tenacious woman.  One of her dreams is to continue increasing her business with more motorcycle taxi vehicles and to build her house.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her with the opportunity to grow as a businesswoman.  The photo is showing shade owing to the roof of her motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy another vehicle

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.ru: Исомиддин женатый 29 - летний мужчина. У него двое детей. Он занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области четыре года. Он берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Isomiddin is a married 29 year old man. He has two children. He is in animal husbandry. He raises cattle for future sale. He has been in this line of work for four years. He is requesting a loan to purchase a few steers.

loans.use: purchase a few steers.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 37 years old, married and has 10 children, four of whom are in school.  

Marissa is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and has been in business for seven years.  Marissa has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Ms. Thua is 37 years old with four children who are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice, vegetables and is raising some pigs for meat. She joined SEDA’s credit program in 2007, and has used loans effectively toimprove the productivity of her agricultural production process. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivating.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs and fertilizer for cultivating

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin lives with her husband and daughters. She is engaged in agriculture. Besides agriculture, Angin runs a little bakery, where she makes and sells bread. 

Angin has applied for a loan to cultivate her land and develop her bakery. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase seeds and flour. This loan will help Angin to develop her farming, as well as increase the production in the bakery. 

Angin hopes she will develop the bakery and create jobs for members of the community in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and flour.

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Finesse est un regroupement de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne 35  ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à HEREMAKONO NORD, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures avec  SALIMATA , de la fabrication et vente de savons traditionnels et des légumes.
SALIMATA, en T-shirt bleu,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux colis de chaussures en plastiques. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable journalièrement ou hebdomadairement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Finesse is a group composed of 4 women who, in average, are 35, have 6 children, and live in nuclear families in HEREMAKONO NORD, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).
This is the first time they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women is into shoes with SALIMATA, vegetables, and making and selling traditional soap.
With this loan, SALIMATA, wearing a blue T-shirt, plans on buying 2 loads of plastic shoes. She buys these items at the big market of Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. She sells them retail at the market in Bougouni as well as door-to-door to a customer base composed mainly of women, who pay cash or on credit, daily or weekly.
She plans on making an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband pay for their daily expenses. The other part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children, ages 7, 4 and 1. He recently opened his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial services to people in the community of Chikola, which is located in the mining town of Chingola, Zambia. 

Kelvin is requesting a Kiva loan to help him purchase a Zoona-brand trading booth. This will help Kelvin to save the rental costs he currently pays at a shop location. It will also improve his business's branding image which will help bring in more customers.  

This is Kelvin’s first Kiva loan. He is grateful for this opportunity and explains that getting a bank loan in Zambia is very difficult. He looks forward to getting another Kiva loan so he can continue to scale up his business.

Kelvin’s biggest dream is to provide all his children with a college education so they can have the opportunity to do whatever they desire. He is hopeful that the success of his business will help make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona-brand trading  booth

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Many people in Siongiroi are poor and most of them find an opportunity in farming to make a living and progress through practicing mixed farming. Such is the case of Richard who, at the age of 35, has gone through many adversities but has always put on a brave face. 
For the past ten years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. 

Richard passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and buy another quality breed of dairy cow. The dairy unit will assist Richard in managing his cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions. Richard also intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and through this loan she will be making more money. 

For Richard, nothing is impossible. He wants to continue working to fulfill his dream of becoming the lead supplier of milk in his village.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit and buy another cow

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells cosmetics, clothes and jewelry. She has been in this line of work for about 8 years. Prior to this, she had a small stand where she sold fruits and vegetables, but she had to close down after she became ill. After she got better, she decided to start a business that was more flexible. She sells all types of women’s items to her friends and neighbors. Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

Carmen has three children, two of which are already working. Her youngest child, a nine year old boy, has a mental disability. It is very rough for her to raise him because she has limited access to psychological and medical services, but her son receives all the love and care her family can offer.

loans.use: Carmen needs the loan in order to make a last round of investments before the year closes.

loans.name: Yokunda

texts.en: Yokunda resides at Mtakuja in the Ilala District of  Dar es Salaam. She is married and has five children. One is in primary school,three are in secondary school and the others are in kindergarten. Yokunda owns a retail shop selling various consumable items. She has operated the shop for more than six years now. She recently realized that her profit margin has been declining due to the increased number of competitors in the area. In a plan to improve her profit margin, Yokunda has decided to add some items in her shop that her competitors do not have. She also plans to open another shop on the next street. These new strategies require additional capital. From her own savings, Yokunda cannot finance her business plan. She is in need of an additional USD 1000 to implement her plan. She expects that this strategy will enable her to earn more income to meet her family requirements and pay for school fees for her children. She has a dream of becoming a big wholeseller in her area.

loans.use: to add stock to her shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells foods such as beans, rice, and flour outside her house in Manyatta, Kisumu. Grace is married with 2 children. She has repaid her first loan of 25 USD and wishes to receive a loan of 150 USD to pay for an annual license and to diversify the range of products she sells.

loans.use: To purchase a business license and expand my business

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu T. is 45 years old and married with five children.  He sells second-hand clothes in the open air market in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With his previous loan from SMT, T. was able to increase his stock. He would now like a second loan of $175 so that he can include children’s clothes.  His hope is that his business profits will allow him to see that his children succeed with their education.

loans.use: Diversify his stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
"I still need to build a security fence for the side of my house that will give more security to my family, because there have been lots of robberies in the neighborhood where we live. Also, I would like to buy some blocks to make a little room in the back part of my home." I am requesting $500 to put up a fence and buy blocks to make a little room."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Me hace falta levantar la barda que esta al lado de mi casa para darle más seguridad a mi familia, ya que han robado mucho en ese fraccionamiento en donde vivimos, también me gustaría comprar algunos blocks para hacer un cuarto pequeño en la parte de atras”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner una barda y comprar blocks para hacer un cuarto.

loans.use: Build a fence for security and buy construction blocks.

loans.name: Cristina De

texts.es:
Cristina is a 42 year old woman that makes her living selling food in a stand that is located at Tres esquina avenue Rodolfo Palenque in the city of El Alto.. She lives in the house that she owns from Monday to Saturday , which is located in the Lucio Perez Velasco street in the zone of General Pando (Senkata Sector). She lives there with her two sons. One of them is in college and the other one goes to school

Her husband works some works at a lodge. Cristina works making meals. Even though there is a big competition in this market, her long trajectory allows her to have fixed clients, since it is characterized being very hygienic and to have an excellent treatment to her clients. She always ends up selling the food that prepares for the day. All the meals that she makes have different prices that are different by the amount and variety.

The present request is for the acquisition of construction material, since they will make improvements and extensions to his house. Cristina does not have negative antecedents in the financial system

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina, de 42 años de edad es una señora que se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto que se encuentra ubicado en la Calle Tres esquina Av. Rodolfo Palenque de la ciudad de El Alto de lunes a sábado. La cliente vive en su domicilio propio, que se encuentra ubicado en la calle Lucio Perez Velasco en la zona de General Pando (Sector Senkata), en el mismo vive con sus dos hijos uno se encuenta en la universidad y el otro sigue asistiendo al colegio, su esposo trabaja de formal eventual en un alojamiento. Cristina trabaja como comerciante de comida desde hace seis años, si bien existe competencia en este mercado, su larga trayectoria le permite tener clientes fijos, ya que se caracteriza por ser muy higiénica y tener un excelente trato a los comensales, siempre termina de vender la comida que elabora para el día. Todos los platos que elabora tiene diferentes precios que se diferencian por la cantidad y variedad, además también influye la demanda que tengasn los mismos. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de material de construcción, ya que efectuarán mejoras y ampliaciones a su vivienda. Cristina no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Dilafruz A. has been selling women's clothing since 2003. Despite her young age she has been successful in her business. Her business's development is illustrated by the growth of her revenues which shows that she has been good at using her working capital. Dilafruz uses her loans to increase her product assortment, in order to not lose customers and to attract new ones. She always tries to get new products and to be competitive.

Dilafruz recently married and her husband helps her to transport her products. He has his own business and together they plan to save money to purchase an apartment. (In the photo you can see Dilafruz on the right, pictured on the left is her sister). When Dilafruz found out about KIVA she asked for an additional loan to purchase new products. Since she has been successfully paying back her current loan from MicroInvest, the committee has approved her for posting on the KIVA site.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva volunteer.

Дилафруз Артикова занимается продажей женской одежды с 2003 года. Несмотря на то, что она молодая, она достаточно умело ведет бизнес. О развитии её бизнеса можно наблюдать по росту её активов, что свидетельствует о хорошем обороте денежного капитала. Полученные займы от нашей организации она полностью вкладывает в расширение ассортимента, чтобы не потерять клиентов и привлечь новых. Она всегда старается обновлять свой ассортимент и быть конкурентоспособной. Она недавно вышла замуж, и её муж помогает ей с транспортировкой товара. У него отдельная торговая точка и они вместе планируют накопить деньги на будущую квартиру.(На фото она с права, со своей сестрой) Она узнав о сушесвовании такой программы как КИВА,попросила дополнительный займ на закупки нового ассортимента товара,Так как она успешно погашает свой текущий займ c Микроинвеста, на комитете этот клиент была утвержденна на размешение на сайт КИВА.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en: Mercy has a poultry farm. She intends to use the extra profits to construct another brooder (chicken house) to expand the business.

loans.use: To build a chicken house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana C. is currently separated from her from her husband, and has a 4-year-old daughter: her pride and joy.

Ana owns a bookstore located in front of a school. Thanks to this optimum location, her sales are good. She sells all kinds of school supplies, fashion jewelry, and ice cream, among other items.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise and start the school year offering students a greater variety of accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana C. actualmente esta separada de su esposo tiene una hija de 4 años, quien es su mayor alegría.

Ana posee una librería que esta ubicada frente a un colegio, gracias a esto las ventas son bastante buenas. Ella vende todo tipo de útiles escolares, bijouterie, helados, entre otras cosas.

Ella solicita el crédito de tal forma que pueda comprar mas mercaderías para empezar este año con la mayor variedad de accesorios para los estudiantes.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies such as: notebooks, backpacks, pencils, erasers, paintbrushes, etc.

loans.name: Seke's Msanga 1 Group

texts.en:
Seke is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 8 and 21/2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 25 and 17 years old. Seke sells spare parts. She started in 1990. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business.

In the past, Seke has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who sells cloth.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Club De Madres Enmanuel Group

texts.en:
Wilma is a 31 year-old woman from the community of Imbert, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, where she lives as a single parent with her 12 year-old daughter, a student at a nearby local school . Wilma is currently attending University and hopes to one day be a professional and move to the United States. She received her first loan from Esperanza six months ago, and is now taking out a second. She sells used clothing that she imports from the US, and her business has grown significantly since she first started working with Esperanza. We asked her to tell us a few facts about herself, and she told us that her favorite foods are salami and bananas and that she loves using the Internet in her free time.

Five women in this community have already taken out one loan with Esperanza and five women are new clients. They are all looking forward to this opportunity, and are committed to their families, businesses, and each other! Oh behalf of Esperanza, and all of the women in this group, thank you for your generosity and support. God Bless!

loans.use: To increase imports of used clothing from the U.S.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa S. Q. is a member of the Communal Bank “VISION 2000.” She lives in the San Martín region of Picota province in San Hilarión state. Her business is located on Marginal avenue at Fernando Belaunde Terri highway, where she sells groceries, candy, and other consumable products.

She studied in the university to be a teacher but did not finish her degree due to lack of money for tuition.

With the loan for S/1500, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy a variety of packaged noodles, crates of preserved fish, sacks of rice and sugar, liters of oil, and stock up on soda pop and candy as well as home and personal care products.

Rosa has two children, her husband helps her with everything, and together they dream of have a bigger business and ensure the well-being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa S. Q., es socia del Banco Comunal ,“VISIÒN 2000” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión su negocio está ubicado en la avenida Marginal , carretera Fernando Belaunde Terri, vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario.

Tiene estudio superiores no concluidos de profesora, que los dejo por falta de medios económicos para continuar estudiando.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, además de surtir con bebidas gasificadas y golosinas y productos de aseo para el hogar y personal.

Rosa tiene doshijos, su esposo la apoya en todo, juntos sueñan con tener un negocio más grande y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana M. is a 22-year-old woman who has bred sheep in the Bilasuvar region since 2003. She raises and sells the sheep to local bazaar traders and local people. A meal of mutton is especially popular at summer wedding parties. She lives with her husband and daughter, and her husband's parents. All the members of her family are unemployed and it is very hard to cover their basic needs. Tarana has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase ten sheep ($60 each) and fodder ($200). She believes that during the wedding season she could sell many sheep, the sales of which will enable her to purchase more sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a woman who is, without a doubt, an excellent farmer and mother. She works arduously day after day so her products are the best at the market where she sells them. For this, she makes sacrifices to adequately care for and fertilize her lands. Above all, she pays the highest respect for keeping them clean so that her fields can bear high-quality products.

One of Florencia's dreams is to increase the size of her fields, but that is, doubtlessly, an investment she cannot make solely on her own. For this, she is requesting economic support, money that will help in the purchase of lands and crops. She hopes that you will heed her call and will be forever grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Florencia es una mujer que sin duda es buena madre y excelente agricultora, ella se esfuerza día a día para que sus productos sean los mejores del mercado donde los vende. Por ello, se sacrifica cuidando y abonando adecuadamente sus tierras, y sobre todo dándole los respectivos mantenimientos de limpieza para que sus plantaciones puedan dar productos de buena calidad. Uno de sus deseos es poder aumentar la proporción de sus cultivos, sin duda esto es una gran inversión que sola no puede afrontar. Por ello pide su apoyo económicoa, dinero que le ayudaría en la compra de plantaciones y de su vivero . Florencia espera que usted pueda atender a su solicitud. Se mantendrá agradecida toda su vida por su apoyo.

loans.use: Increase crop production and purchase new fields / Ampliar la producción de sus cultivos y compra de nuevas plantaciones.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 40-year-old divorced mother of four. Two of her children have completed senior high school. She sells baby clothes, diapers, baby powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles and the like through hawking, balancing her stock on her head and walking miles to her customers' doors.

She is seeking a loan to increase her stock and thus expand her business, making her better able to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of a community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group members provide guarantees for one another and assist one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of baby care supplies

loans.name: Siti's Tuwe Na Moyo Group

texts.en:
Siti is 36 years. She is married with two children aged seven and two years old. She has been a perfumes and clothes seller since 2003. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Siti now hopes for a loan to buy more perfumes and clothes to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Amina.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes and clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Osman Guillermo

texts.es: Don Osaman M., tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, le tiene tres hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 15 años. 12 años y 8 años, cursando la mayor el tercer año de bachillerato. su otro hijo cursa el segundo año de secundaria y su tercer hijo el segundo grado de primaria, su esposa se desempeña como profesora. Don Osman tiene dos años de haber dando inicio a este pequeño proyecto siendo este una pequeña pulperia como producto del desempleo y una manera de aportar a los gastos del hogar. Su mayor sueño es poder llegar a tener una misecelana donde ofertar todos lo productos del hogar asi como cosmeticos, Con los creditos pretende ir creceindo poco a poco y con las ganancias poder ir mejorando sus condicones de vida y economicas de igual manera ir ampliando su negocio hasta logara su sueño, su deseo en la vida es poder dejarle a sus hijos una carrera como profesionales y un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Osman is 34 years old and married with three kids, ages 15, 12 and 8. The oldest is in his third year of high school, the middle is in his second year of middle school, and the youngest is in second grade. His wife makes a living as a teacher. Osman is two years removed from having started his small convenience store when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell household products as well as cosmetics. With the loan he expects to keep growing little by little and with the earnings he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal. His wish in life is to see his children as professionals with prosperous businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase supplies

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji, the wife of M. W., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 15 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Sugran baji’s husband has a motor workshop. Sugran baji herself is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy tools for her husband’s motor workshop. 

She is joined in her loan group by two other members. Hayat baji wants a loan to buy more groceries for her grocery shop. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy a molding machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools to repair vehicles for their motor workshop

loans.name: Hadiaratou Yalcoue

texts.fr:
Madame  H. Yalcoué a 40 ans, vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et ses sept (7) enfants (4 garçons et 3 filles), à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir tenté plusieurs d’activités sans succès, elle  opta de s’initiée à  l’activité d’achat et de vente des  pagnes Wax(tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest),  de tissus brodés,  de draps de lit et de tasses “Super” depuis  maintenant huit (8) ans. Elle mène son activité au marché de son quartier à Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clienèle grâce à la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a cinq (5) ans.  Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Banconi), elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel  et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt: 10 pièces de pagne wax, 10 complets  de tissus brodé, 10 complets de drap et 10 complets de tasse “Super”. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso au Burkina Faso auprès des grossistes sur commandes.
Elle vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Parallèlement à cette activité principale le commerce, elle fait la prestation de service à savoir la couture. Elle coud les habits de ses voisins du quartiers et de ses clientes ce qui lui apporte des recettes couvrant l’essentielles de ses dépenses. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. H. Yalcoué, age 40, lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wives, and seven children (four boys and three girls) in Banconi, one of the outlying districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having tried several kinds of work without success, she opted to become initiated eight years ago in the commerce of 'Wax' pagnes (highly prized cloth in West Africa), embroidered fabrics, bedsheets, and 'Super' basins. She works at the marketplace of her district in Sikasso where she is in high demand by her customers, thanks to the quality of her goods. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After five solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association of her district (Association Benkadi de Banconi), she is now on her fourth individual loan. All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She intends to use this loan to buy: 10 lengths of 'Wax' pagnes, 10 sets of embroidered fabrics, 10 sets of sheets, and 10 sets of 'Super' basins. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso from wholesalers by special order. She sells her goods, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed essentially of women. Concurrent to this principal commerce, she works in the service sector, specifically dressmaking. She sews clothing for her neighbors and customers, who provide her with revenues that cover her main expenses. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA, which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 'Wax' pagnes, embroidered fabrics, bedsheets, and 'Super' basins

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim L., 29, is a grocery seller who lives in Prongel Commune in Pursat Province. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, plastic goods, canned foods, soft drinks, beers, and cakes. She began her business in 2000, and receives a profit of approximately $4 per day. 

She is married and cares for one young child who is attending school. Her husband, Phat Chay, is a 35-year-old rice farmer, who also raises pigs in their home to help meet the family's expenses. Mrs. L. hopes to expand her business, so she would like to request a loan to purchase a range of groceries items to store and resell.

loans.use: To purchase groceries items

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
A causa de la despedida de su esposo en su trabajo ella tuvo que salir en busca de un trabajo. Como no pudo ser contratada por ninguna empresa, ella decidió abrir un pequeño puesto ambulante en un mercado cerca a su casa. Ella dedica todo el día a su venta de frutas desde hace diez años. Siempre con el objetivo de mantener a toda su familia. 
Andrea, en un inicio todas las ganancias de su negocio las dedicaba a su hogar, sin embargo poco a poco ha aprendido que debe reinvertir en su negocio si quiere mantenerlo. Con mucho esfuerzo y responsabilidad ella ha logrado mucho y aún espera progresar más para poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Because her husband's dismissal from work, Andrea had to search for a job. As she could not receive an employment offer from any company, Andrea decided to open a small stand in a market near her home. For the past 10 years, she has her days selling fruit, always focused on providing for her entire family.
In the beginning, Andrea spent all her profits on her household, however, she gradually learned that she must reinvest in her business if she wants to keep it running. With much effort and responsibility, Andrea has achieved quite a bit, and still hopes to progress more in efforts to complete the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase/improve her fruit stand

loans.name: Alikul

texts.en:
Alikul M. is married and the father of five children. He works as a farmer every day. Educated up to secondary school, he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to attend high school. Alikul, with a good work ethic, has whole-heartedly committed himself to agriculture.

Thanks to his hard work, he has today become a man known for his determination and serves as an example and reference for other farmers. He has been growing potatoes and wheat for the past 10 years. He is now seeking a loan of 600 USD to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants for his crops in the hopes of being well-prepared for the upcoming season and to produce a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his work conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina E. is 44 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and food. She loves this business. Valentina hopes for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more food and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and food
